review_body: I stayed here on business in November for a week. The self serviced apartment had everything I needed and was a lovely size, bed super comfy and linen gorgeous. I had an issue with not understanding the washing machine but thats to do with my ineptness. The whole building is beautiful and effortlessly run. I loved it and was so close to the office for me. The pool is a saving grace too, its open til 10pm so was good to get a swim in every evening before bed to help with the jet lag.

Great location (for us at least); very clean rooms with high quality fixtures, appliances, bedding, toiletries, etc; helpful staff. Great view too facing the imperial palace gardens. I would definitely stay here again... the amount of space and amenities really helped make the trip comfortable for 2 people.

Very large room for the price. Extremely well maintained and clean. Awesome bathrooms/showers. Very very friendly and helpful staff who assisted us with restaurant bookings and advice. In a very good location, and the view from our apartment on the 28th floor overlooking the imperial palace and gardens was spectacular.

Stayed here as a Platinum Ascott member. Location great - near Tokyo Station and therefore lots of different dining options from cheap and cheerful to high class. Check in fast and efficient. Upgraded a room type due to Ascott status so a very positive start to the stay and hard to go backwards from there!Room was big and spacious and very well decked out. Huge bathroom with bath, with great amenities. Beautiful view over the area from the 25th floor. Comfortable beds. Well appointed kitchenette. Only real gripe is that while the furniture is relatively tasteful and functional, the decor is a bit twee - reminds me of a professional Airbnb fit out, especially the wall hangings which I suspect are identical in every room. Hallways also have pretty ugly carpet and trimmings, but the lobby and shared lounge and outdoor area were actually very stylish. Pretty nice gym, and a small indoor infinity 'gym' pool which is closed to children.Would stay again happily, but maybe more of a business hotel than a family hotel.

The chick in was easy and fast, staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was clean and big, the room quitenes, nice view. Near of Tokyo station And restaurants. The quality of bathroom shampoo body cream was excellent.

Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Ascott Marunouchi is one of the cleanest and most comfortable hotels I've stayed in. The rooms are huge, some having in-room laundry which is great for travelers on long trips. The views are excellent, and the location makes it very easy to get around. You can also jog around the imperial palace just across the street.Ascott Marunouchi is also an excellent deal, when compared to other hotels nearby.

Location is right next to the station, easy to reach and travel from. rooms are spacious and very clean. Staff are very good. Check-in and check out is very quick and easy. Would stay there again no doubt.

Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: We stayed at 2712 from Dec 29.2019 to Jan 1, 2020.We really enjoyed our stay there. We will come back next time for sure. Here are some high lights:1: This hotel is very close to Tokyo station and 大手町 station.We took monorail from 羽田 airport to downtown area then we took a taxi to hotel. It was super easy.2: our room was a Executive suite. It has a kitchen, dining area, living room, bedroom. The best parts are two toilets and one washer plus dryer in one machine.3: it was in a quiet street. I am very worry about the noise. This hotel was clean and quiet.4: all of front desk hotel people can speak very good English. They helped you to reserve restaurants and shipped your luggages to your next travel location.5: one compliant from my son: we added a roll away bed for my 16 years old boy. The bed was tiny and not very comfortable to sleep. Wish hotel can improve it in the future. One compliant from me: they should have a person or doorman in the first floor to help customers for their luggages. Hotel's front desk and lobby was on the 22nd floors.

Very conveniently located. Friendly staff assisted me throughout - checking in, checking out, hailing taxis, printing in the middle of the night.... rooms are big and spacious. Breakfast buffet choices are a bit limited though. But new, clean and very convenient. Overall a very enjoyable stay.

This is an excellent hotel. The staff is very helpful and attentive. Stayed here while on business in early December 2019. The front desk staff will call for a taxi for you and write your destination on a card in Japanese for you to give to the driver. There is also a currency exchange machine right in the lobby. The rooms are very comfortable and Include a small kitchenette with everything you need for an extended stay. Large bathroom, but like most hotels, the lighting in the bathroom is not good, so bringing a travel light up makeup mirror is a must. Once in the room, you cannot hear any outside or hallway noises, very nice after a long day. The lobby is on the 22nd floor of the building. Easy walk to the Imperial Palace Gardens. Subway access and access to convenience stores and food court is in the ground floor (basement) of the building. Nice restaurant within the hotel. Breakfast buffet was very good.

I enjoyed my stay at Ascott Marunouchi Hotel, primarily because of its spacious, bright and modern design, coupled with a sense of privacy for guests. The bathroom is especially nice, with the bath, toilet and and basin compartmentalized into three different sections. Bath salt and wash cloth are a nice touch. It felt really good soaking in a deep tub with sea salt after a long walk. The bathroom comes with a rain shower and another hand-held shower spray. I personally prefer the square-shaped rain shower head, this hotel installs a rectangular rain shower head. There is also a gap above the bathroom door so it will be impossible to create a steam shower, which is a pity.On my first night, though, I was bitten on my leg by a bug on the bed, leaving five very red and itchy bite marks that remained for days. I couldn't find anything on the bed. I called the hotel staff who sent someone to clean the room, but on the second night I was still bitten. The hotel did not offer another room until I requested it. There was no further follow up either. After that, no bug biting incident in the new room. However, on my last night of stay, I put on the pajama provided and my back started to feel itchy. Turned out there were mites on the pajama. Once I removed it, there was no more itch. Another note on housekeeping, I found a cup in the cupboard stained and had a few specks of black dust in it. There were also two hardened small stains in the bathtubs that were not removed.

This hotel was extremely comfortable. The rooms were spacious and attractive and the kitchen area was very nice. It's difficult finding king beds in Japan so this hotel was a great find for us. Being located a short walking distance form Tokyo Station made it extremely convenient.

We stayed for one night after we first landed in Tokyo. The location was very convenient to Tokyo Station and was surrounded by other nice shopping malls/centers with plenty of stores and restaurants. The hotel is located on the upper floors of the building. When you enter the building, you take an elevator up to the 22nd floor to get to the lobby. The entire hotel was extremely modern and beautiful. The lobby had high ceilings and was impeccably decorated. The gym was modern, large, and had a variety of equipment. We were upgraded from a studio to a one bedroom. This was super spacious with 1.5 bathrooms, separate living room with dining area, kitchen, etc... This is a perfect hotel if you're staying with a family or for a long period of time. I can't recommend enough.

My mom and I (and some friends in another room) just had the most glorious stay at the Ascott Marunouchi. The hotel’s reception is located on the 22nd floor of a rather plain office building. But once inside, it’s pure luxury. The front desk staff are so helpful and nice. Check in was a breeze. We stayed on the 26th floor in a deluxe room with a city view. There was a living room area as well. The room itself is equipped with everything you could possibly want. It is so clean and feels brand new. The furniture feels expensive and luxe. There is a kitchen with a full size fridge, dishes, and pans. There is a washing machine/dryer. There is a tub and a shower. Bathrobes too. So much space to spread out in. The hotel itself is located in a pretty business area. Not much going on after hours, but that was fine by us. It’s about a 15-20 min walk from Tokyo Station, where there is a lot going on and tons to do. If in Tokyo again, I would only stay here!

this is my second stay at the Ascott Marunouchi and I plan on staying again when Tokyo calls. The rooms are large and comfortable and very clean. The furnishings are top end as are the amenities. No complaints. It's worth it.

This was definitely the nicest hotel accommodation we stayed at during our four week vacation of Japan. The views of the palace were excellent, the facilities are first class and the staff were available to meet our needs when required.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location is hard to beat. The view over the Imperial Palace and Mt Fuji (on a clear day) is enthralling. The staff were very efficient. Quality of room amenities was exceptional.

Great location, just a few steps away from train station as well as 10 mins walk from Tokyo Station. It's such a peaceful environment in Tokyo, while, it's close to the Imperial Palace, perfect for jogging, not to mention the best facilities and amenities with very helpful staff.

A serviced apartment is a great way to feel at home as opposed to a hotel room. You have the option of cooking a meal, doing laundry and just relaxing at your leisure. The gym and pool are nice-and the Palace is just a block away which has a 5K perimeter running route...be sure to run counterclockwise as the signs note and as the local runners run! The staff is very helpful. I have stayed here many times and plan to stay here for future visits.

Perfectly located close to the Tokyo station. View over the East gardiens of the Imperial palace. Impeccable service modern room with quality bathroom all the comfort you might expect is there including fast and reliable internet.I strongly recommend this hotel very discreet and not si easy to find !

First time staying at a hotel/residence property. I was very impressed from the start on the quality of Ascott. Starting with the employees who were exceptional in their treatment of guests and the quality of the residence in itself. The service received and the amenities were all very good ! I'll certainly consider staying at one of their properties on my next travels. If anyone is going to Tokyo I would definitely recommend staying at the Ascott Marunoucho !!

We recently returned from a week and a half trip to Japan, during which we spent a few of those days in Tokyo. First, the area where the hotel is located is great. Quiet, very clean and right by the Imperial Garden. In addition, it is a few mins walk to Tokyo Station and two nearby shopping malls. The closest station is Otemachi and there are several subway lines crossing that station so it is very convenient to get wherever in Tokyo. The hotel itself is very well maintained and the staff are very friendly. We booked a room with a great view of the Garden and the city in the back. The room was clean and a good size. Also, we had a washer and dryer (all in one) in our room which was very convenient. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Tokyo.

If you’re working in the area a great location. If you’re travelling to see the sights of Tokyo while it’s easy to get around the location is very quiet. Hotel itself is beautiful. Very clean. Great service. No room service but Uber Eats is easy. Would stay here for work (like I did) but sold choose another location for pleasure travel.

I spent 3 nights at Ascott Marunouchi Tokyo on a business trip in July 2019 and was very satisfied with the hotel. Rooms - designed for extended stays with a kitchen corner and a washing machine - are very spacious, well appointed and comfortable. However, the best thing with at least part of them is the view. My room was located on the 27th floor and offered great views over the Imperial Palace, the Imperial Palace Garden and the Parliament. Probably not many hotels in Tokyo can match Ascott Marunouchi in that respect. Efficient and professional service. Very good breakfast buffet. Ascott Marunouchi is an excellent option for short and long stays inTokyo that I have no hesitation to recommend.

Great location and agree with others its great when you need to stay more than 2-3 night. Hotel has a washing machine (instructions in english but no instructions about where to place the powder or liquid). It also has a kitchen if you're not too fond of eating out every night or don't like the variety of restaurants you find in Tokyo. My room this time (7night stay) had probably been upgraded and so i had a lounge as well as the standard bedroom with extra study space . Only issue is the restaurant. Poor or limited breakfast choice. The restaurant closes at weekends, and even on a weekday, lunch service is short. I heard one lady this morning being turned away because she was 5 minutes late arriving for last orders. She could have surely just sat and ate the buffet menu. The hot order food choices is fried eggs, omelette or scrambled eggs. Again that takes seconds to prepare. The food in buffet choices should be hot but i ate very cold sausages three days in a row. For a luxury hotel apartment i think this is poor. I also came back just a few minutes past three, asked if I could have a beer and nibbles in their restaurant but was turned away as they were only serving tea. Again no "omotenashi" mindset. Given it incredible cost, think they don't live up to the first class standards. And house keeping cut corners as the week progressed. Missing toilet roll, dirty un- emptied bins, missing dressing gowns, no slippers replaced, tea towel wet (ie not changed)... Needs to be reviewed hotel managers! I know we get corporate rates but its still an expensive hotel. Wont recommend to my colleagues in future..

Staff were friendly and professional. They all spoke fluent English.The rooms were spacious and clean. Each of our rooms got a pantry and a washing machine.As we stayed on a high floor, the view was gorgeous!Wifi was strong too! :)

What a great way to start a trip to Tokyo. The Ascott apartments are spacious and luxurious. Was a great way to unwind from a long flight. Rooms are exceptionally well kept and clean. It’s also located in a great area. Not overly busy and walking distance from great eateries and things to do. Loved it and highly recommend.

I had a great stay here. Complimentary upgrade, fantastic service and location.The food was excellent and great location to have as basis to explore Tokyo.I am pleasently surprised by the cleanliness and staff members.

I enjoyed my one bedroom apartment for my week stay in Tokyo. The hotel was clean and need and if you need to be in the Business District of Tokyo, this is a nice choice. It was great be able to do laundry also. It would have been nice if there was a Bar/Lounge or a place to get a cocktail on site, but otherwise no complaints.

This is my third time staying in Ascott Mauronuchi Tokyo. The staff are very friendly and the service, location and facilities are just great! My stay in the deluxe room equips with kitchen and decent dining room. I just want to stay here as like my home

For me it is important that I can feel at the hotel almost like home: If there is a kitchen full of your own snacks and breakfast ingredients, and a washing machine for your sweaty shirts, everyting is much easier at your holiday.We used the washing machine every single day that we stayed at this hotel. The same machine is also a drying machine, but take something from home for washed clothes, like gym rubber band, (we happen to had that ) It was easy to put to the bath room as a wire and easier to sleep when no machine is on.We liked the decoration and the atmospere of the hotel and its rooms. Nice view from the 28th floor to the Otemachi area (sky crapers) Direct access from the hotels 1st floor to the basement, and to the subway. Otemachi metro station is big and you can go anywhere from there. It is also possible to walk 10 minutes to Tokyo station (Shinkansen station) but as we made a mistake exit on arrival at the Tokyo Station, we missed our plans and where too far away from the hotel with all the luggages. Luckily the taxi line moved fast and the taxi driver understood our destination when we showed it from the Google Maps (we had no language together with the driver. Taxi ride cost 800 yeni).The hotel staff speak very good english from the man at the elevator to everybody at the front desk. They gave us advices go to go to different places, where is the next grocery store etc. Staff is very friendly.The hotel has a gym with some free weighs. It was possibly to do your daily gym program there, but a barbell would be nice. +Wifi worked well. +Iron plus iron board +Wine glasses at the kitchen plus all the other thing, pans and spoons. (Only that it is difficult to go to grocery store in Tokyo as you have no idea what could be for example olive oil for frying... and what bottle only looks like olive oil bottle put it is not... same thing with yoghurt and other cans) +Fridge+Very good housekeeping+Bath room amenities+Separare bath and shower +two tv:s at the deluxe room (one in bed room, on in living room)+Bed room had sliding doors to to living room+Total silence+Washing machine for clothes and dish washerI would definetely stay at this hotel, if I ever visit Tokyo again.

Excellent serviced apartments -- very clean, nice furnishings and good space/facilities for the bedroom suites. Good location if anyone wants to stay away from the busy shopping areas but at the same time reachable in a few subway stops. Wonderful staff.

review_body: This hotel was absolutely amazing with complete attention to detail. To access the train station, you simply have to go to the next building and go down 2 floors via the elevator. In terms of location, you can not get any better. Most restaurants are within a 5-20 minute walk! Just walking around the hotel is stunning in itself. All you have to do is walk 6 minutes and you're at the Imperial Palace Gardens. There are also many travel companies that can take you to Mt Fuji within close range of this hotel. All the staff speak clear English with a mild accent and are more than happy to spend as much time as possible to help you best navigate the city.The hotel rooms are also incredibly clean. There is not a stain or an irregularity in sight. Overall, the customer service was astounding and the location is perfect to experience all that Tokyo can offer. I highly recommend this hotel to experience luxury in a city that is already so beautiful.

We absolutely loved this hotel - great room facilities, excellent service from the front desk, conveniently located, but the one thing that let it down for us was the beds! They were hard and uncomfortable. We had 2 rooms that were adjoining and both rooms had this issue for us (luckily the kids don’t notice these things, only us fussy adults!) but this for us is a bit of a let down. The breakfast was also a bit average but with a kitchenette in your room we didn’t need to go to breakfast as we picked up some supplies from the food hall at Takashimaya. Would have liked to see a bar in the foyer but not a huge deal. The rooms are clean, spacious with great bathrooms, with kitchens & laundry facilities.Maybe other styles of rooms have more comfortable beds (we had 2 studios) and if they could guarantee that we’d go back for sure!

I’m staying here on a long business trip, so finding a place where you can relax after a long day is important. The Ascott has been perfect, the rooms are spotless, the food delicious and the staff here are impeccable..

Second stay at Ascott and the level of service, amenities and rooms are still very good. Apartment is located close to a subway line and is within walking distance to Tokyo station. The imperial palace is also located in close proximity.

The apartment was very clean, spacious and well equipped. There are washing machine and dishwater, and there are different kinds of utensils in the kitchen. It could even accommodate two baby cots. It is easily accessible to the carpark which is good especially for us with many luggages.However, it was difficult to find the carpark entrance and the carpark shares with another office building. In the sign outside, we could not read the name of the apartment, until we carefully read every sign and finally found one saying that it is for the apartment (but it is difficult as we were on the road driving).

This hotel is a worth every penny! Recently stayed in room 2511 and was beyond delighted. The hotel is tranquil, the décor is beautifully modern and the food is very good. The rooms are very clean, spacious and comfortable. Dined at the AMAN across the street and it didn't compare. The only con is the in-room washing machine/dryer. It’s an all in one with an air dryer. A stand-alone heated dryer is definitely needed (but hardly a deal breaker). A big Thank You to the male receptionist that came to help at 4:30 in the morning on Friday May 31st.

I spent one week in Tokyo visiting museums, gardens and shrines. The idea of having a studio with the possibility and appliances to cook gave me a lot of freedom. The hotel staff were amazing and helped me with all my little questions and problems from how to travel in Tokyo to how to use the hob. The pool was fantastic thus bring swimwear because it is not so easy to find it in the shops and the Japanese fashion is different from the European one . The hotel and its people made my stay in Tokyo a fantastic experience to remember .

When you want to travel in style and pamper yourself, this is the place to stay. Clean and bright room with a good kitchenette if you decide to cook a snack for yourself. We had a free upgrade to a deluxe room and it comes with dishwasher and washing machine (not that we need it)! The bedsheet is super soft and smooth that makes you don’t really want to get out of bed!Staff are all very friendly and speaks many languages. Breakfast selection is not as elaborate but good selection. The green curry is out of this world! The waffles are the best from any hotel we have stayed in (give it a toast). We will sure to come back if we are in Tokyo again!

luxurious hotel within close reach of the imperial palace and Tokyo training station. Rooms were big, brilliantly decorated and well equip. This hotel is particular usual for those who need to travel to Narita airport and other cities such as Kyoto, Osaka etc (walking distance to Narita express & bullet trains in Tokyo station). Would highly recommend.

The room was very well furnished and everything you could need was included from cooking equipment to washing machine and detergent. The bathroom was comfortably furnished and the shower was very luxurious. The shared areas are decorated beautifully. The gym is exceptionally well equipped and the Imperial Park is nearby if you like running. It is very well located to access anywhere else in the city. The service was exceptional.

Hotel is in a great location only 15 mins walking from Tokyo Station, which is a must for the trains and metro, you also have a metro station on the doorstep. Staff friendly and professional. Room was great very large, shower amazing and the bed was a delight to sleep in. Breakfast was also good with plenty of choice. Would highly recommend.

Stayed 4 nights here. The hotel room is super big in Tokyo standard and has great sound segregation. It’s tastefully designed and equipped with a kitchen (because a Scott is essentially a serviced apartment). This makes cooking on your own and trying out Japanese supermarket food very convenient. The location is perfect as it’s situated right outside the c9 exit of Otemachi station which has several JR lines and is a short walk to Tokyo station and a lot of malls and restaurants. The palace is right across from the hotel, so it has pretty amazing unblocked view on the higher levels and in the morning it’s nice to go for a run around the palace. For business travelers the hotel is also close to all the major banks and financial institutions. I also like the hotel because it’s not sitting right next to an outside train track like most of the other hotels in Japan. This it’s very quiet and you don’t hear trains coming and going constantly in the night.

My husband and I have traveled to well over 40 countries and the Ascott is by far our favorite hotel. The pictures online do not do it justice. The reception area is located on the 24th floor of an office building. The service is outstanding from the hosts at the front desk to housekeeping, everyone is friendly, professional and very customer friendly. The rooms are gorgeous. I love the fact that the floors are hardwood instead of carpet. The beds are comfortable, the air-conditioning gets very cold, the rain fall showers have powerful water pressure and the water gets very hot. The toilets are top-of-the-line, the sinks are clean including the drain holes. They even have their own personalized scented room deodorizing spray which they leave near your bed. The hotel is located directly above a metro station so you don’t even have to leave the building. There are also shops below the building for coffee, breakfast and light shopping. We absolutely love this hotel and will definitely be back.

The first time in Tokyo, the hotel was an excellent choice for us. Good location next to the metro station. The staff was very friendly and helpful. With great views of the Emperor's Park and the whole of Tokyo.

Wonderful stay. The location is absolutely fabulous. The staff was very into helping and solving problems without being annoying . The equipment in the room is perfect. Our children (2 y and 9 months) and we felt completely happy during our stay.

After a very early start to our day and a long flight with a 15mth old, we were welcomed at Ascott with a very warm and friendly reception.We had booked a one bedroom apartment. A little exxy, but that’s what you pay for in Tokyo. And it was worth every cent!Pros: - Space!! Lots of space to spread out luggage and relax and if you were staying longer, plenty of cupboard space to pack things away.- THE MOST COMFORTABLE HOTEL BED! I literally slid into bed and said to my husband “holy sh!+ these sheets feel so good”. It made for a great nights sleep after a very long day.- Kitchenette. This surprised me as I didn’t realize we were getting one. But loved the convenience of having it.- Customer service. Everyone we met and dealt with were so helpful and welcoming. - The pool! Didn’t use it, but looked amazing. Cons:- We only stayed one night.- Location. Great if you want to be situated in the cbd, but for “touristy” stuff there’s not a lot nearby so you’d have to train it to most entertainment areas, which isn’t a negative.

Strategically located above the Otemachi train station, and East Garden of the Imperial Palace is just a 3 mins walk away. Hotel is also well connected underground to the Tokyo main station, a 5-7 mins walk.We had a 2 bedder and felt so at home. Was spacious, new and clean. Breakfast was great too; apart from the usual western and Japanese food spread, there are also items that changed daily (eg S’pore fried bee hoon, Szechuan soup, etc)Staffs at the receptions are so attentive and friendly; greeted us whenever we walked past. Well done and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Stayed October-November 2018 for 11 nights in an executive 1 bedroom.Absolutely perfect base and place to relax in Tokyo. Bed was comfortable, apartment was very clean - lived up to the 5 star rating for sure. We would definitely come back and have reccomended to others already.

My wife and I loved our stay at the Ascott. It is in the perfect location, convenient to the subway and Tokyo Train station, just outside the entrance to the Imperial Palace gardens. There are several restaurants nearby and the subway is accessible through the underground directly under the hotel building. And oh yeah, the rooms - Wow! Full kitchen with washer/dryer make it easy to cook breakfast or supper if you don’t want to go out. Very modern, clean, Japanese decor with plenty of drawers and closets for storage. Every amenity is provided that you would expect to find in a high end luxury hotel. The rate is high but if you join the Ascott club you can get 10% discount. Highly recommend. Looking forward to returning when we are next in Tokyo.

Family of 5 with kids 13, 11, 9; 2-bedroom apartment, early-bird rate which did not include breakfast (rate available only if you sign-up to be a member, which is free).Pros: -attentive 5-star staff in all areas-clean, well appointed and decorated rooms, very comfortable-washing machine and dryer alone made it worthwhile over typical hotels-very good breakfast buffet; though not cheap, comparable to typical hotel-connects directly to multiple metro lines, actually able to walk to Tokyo Station (10 min) entirely via underground passage (FYI, if you're carrying luggage, a few stairs and escalators to negotiate).-good size rooms for Tokyo hotelsCons:-fitness center is small but adequate, does open 24 hours-pool only open to 16 years or older, but that seems quite common in Tokyo-Lobby is on 26th floor- you have to call for bell staff which is a delay. We just went up ourselves. Even though our driver called ahead for us, no one was downstairs waiting.-requested room on high floors facing Imperial Garden but did not get eitherOverall the cons were minor in my opinion. I looked through many hotels in the area and have stayed at several in the past, and this by far was the best experience, and the best price for the quality. I did not try lunch or dinner, and there is only one restaurant which is not open on weekends for dinner (and maybe also lunch, can't recall). But if you're visiting, you'll likely be exploring any way. It does have more of a business hotel feel in some sense, but it suited us just fine.

The hotel was perfect for our family group of seven. The staff were most friendly and provided excellent advice. Highly recommended,with great location with easy access to subway. Would gladly return on next trip to Tokyo

Well, the Ascott Marunouchi is still a great hotel after a two years hiatus. The staff is excellent and the hotel beautiful and well located. The breakfast is still too much orientated for chinese clientele but other than that everything was perfect.

Saint-Martin, St Martin / St Maarten

review_body: We stayed for a week, its location was good and the fact that the hotel is connected to the tram system is brilliant.The room had a perfec view to the imperial Palace, super clean and freshHad all the amenities (cooker, oven/microwave, pot, pan, utensils, washing machine with dryer)Staff was very friendly and helpfulI recommend it for anyone visiting Tokyo

This place is a lot more than your average hotel. It's more like an apartment hotel, but with all the facilities of a top-notch hotel. My room had a separate living room away from the bedroom and also featured a kitchenette with a big fridge. It was great to store your freshly purchased sake on ice :)The location of the hotel is brilliant. 10min from Tokyo central station. The station where the bullet trains are "take off" to places like Kyoto, Osaka. You are also next door to the gorgeous Imperial Palace gardens. The staff was super friendly and helpful, but I think that's a default behaviour all around in Japan.

I have just completed a 5 night stay here. I was very impressed with the high standard and the following are my highlights:- Great sized room (almost like an apartment) with separate sink, microwave, fridge and cutlery. Had all the mod cons plus a coffee machine and kettle (very important for jetlag)!- Loads of power points (Japanese and USB) so could charge multiple devices.-Curtains excellent so room very dark at night which is great for sleep.-I loved the little touches like the room spray, slippers, pyjamas and robe.Hotel itself is located on 22nd floor. The taxi took us to the back of it so was slightly tricky to find the front door but we found in the end!Has a nice pool, which is quite small but was often empty. The gym is excellent, very big, was usually quiet and has good kit. I took a few pictures.Overal I would definitely stay again! Location is excellent near Otemachi tube (which connects to many lines). You can easily walk to the Imperial Palace and Tokyo station. While it is quite a quiet area (esp on a Sunday when everything seemed to be shut), there is an underground shopping centre underneath with a 7/11 to get snacks and some restaurants for lunch.

A friend recommended the Ascott as it was newly built and within a 10 min walk from Tokyo station. Super accessible from various subway lines nearby made this hotel awesome for us.We have always missed sakura season with all of our previous trips and was fortunate to catch the sakuras in full bloom this trip. This hotel is less than a 20 min walk to Chidorigafuchi park which is a spectacular place to view cherry blossoms. It was so good that we went back there 4x. Hotels were super expensive late Mar/Apr and our usual hotel was over 1k/night. Decided to finally try this hotel as it's location is awesome and even had a washing machine in the room. Exchanged several emails asking for confirmation and booked our room the next day. Wasn't expecting much but was blown away as I walked into the room. Inside was a full kitchen w/stove, a fridge, dining table, couch, tatami mattress area, full king sized bed and 2 bathrooms. Had to pinch myself as I couldn't believe the sheer size of this room. As with every hotel in Japan, everything was clean and is well maintained. Cleaning service did a great job of tidying up each morning. Front desk personnel were there to help answer questions and always welcomed us back. Internet here is amazingly fast and reliable.My only complaint was with the bath products they offer. Wasn't exactly a fan or the scent and ended up picking some stuff up at a Lawson's. Wished they still offered the l'occitane products. Will more than likely be staying here going forward.I freaking love this hotel but wished they were apart of a bigger chain.

We love our 5 nights at Ascott Marunouchi. It’s awesome in so many ways - clean, great view of Mount Fuji on clear days and very comfortable beds(even the day bed is great!). The room is spacious with plenty of thoughtful storage. The water pressure in the bathroom is strong and the temperature is consistent - our next hotel in Disney Resort wasn’t. We like the wooden flooring, our kids will sit on the floor and eat which we do not allow on carpeted floor. The kitchenette is very useful - Ascott provides detergent and also wiping cloth. Location wise, we found it much easier to walk on the pavement rather than taking a subway to Tokyo Station. It feels shorter and we used Google Maps to navigate rather than the signage in the subways to avoid the many staircases underground. The hotel is friendly to businesses and families but it’s quiet in most areas - as we have 2 young kids, we avoid the breakfast and do not hang around much in the common areas/lobby. Overall, it’s as great as the reviews earlier on and we are looking forward to returning in June.

I am happy I chose this hotel for my first night stay in Tokyo. It is conveniently located to Tokyo Station and a few minutes walk away from the Imperial Gardens. The hotel is spotlessly clean, great service and the breakfast buffet was quite tasty. The spa facilities were actually way nicer than I imagined as well. The indoor pool is lovely and pretty awesome. The rooms and bathrooms were spacious. I did not use the kitchenette in the room as we wanted to try the local restaurants. I personally do not like to cook on vacation, but it is a good option for families with fussy eaters.

Amazing service. Great efficiency on check I and check out. Hard to beat location. Got lucky and got a free upgrade; this was great as I was on my honey moon.A great place for traveling families, couples or bruisesses.

This place was awesome! First the convenience being attached to the Otemachi station is perfect, then you take the elevator to the 22nd floor to check in. The views from our room were captivating and the room itself felt very upscale, clean, great Wi-Fi, very nice bathroom and amenities with a good sizes kitchenette that had a refrigerator and besides so machine and small over/ microwave. They even had a few English channels on tv! There are so many restaurants and shopping within minutes and it is literally a few minutes walk (whether above ground or using the underground system) from Tokyo station. You can take the Narita express from the airport to Tokyo station and save so much money rather than using a taxi and it is way faster! We loved the staff, so friendly and accommodating and eager to please, you feel special from the minute you walk in the door. We will be back!

Everything is great at this hotel! The staff, cleaning, location, bathroom, breakfast - and basically all!!!Highly recommended!!! :)The best hotel ever!My 3rd time at this hotel and it's a great experience and conviniance every time!

The apartment we stayed in was awesome! It was well designed with very nice kitchen, dining, living area, baths and even a patio for yoga, etc. We got to enjoy superb view of the Imperial Gardens overlooking nearby buildings. Service was immaculate too!

As first time travellers to Tokyo we loved staying at the Ascott Marunouchi, these serviced apartments are exquisite in every single way. Despite being serviced apartments, in no way did we feel like the services were in any way less than a 5 star hotel. Fantastic location in the business district. Right next to the Imperial Palace, Otemachi subway station and Tokyo train station. The one bedroom executive was spacious, luxurious and perfect for our needs as a base to explore Tokyo. We couldn't recommend this accomodation more highly.

Clean & fresh fragrance environment with designed ambience. Able to communicate in clear English language. Supply sufficient mineral water without asking. Most latest and branded toiletries with excellent fragrance in bathroom.Well equipped kitchen ware. Cool lighting all around.

We stayed for 3 nights and was delighted with the friendliness and helpful attitude of the staff. The apartment, its facilities and its cleanliness was just perfect. Ascott Marunouchi is in a wonderful position in Tokyo; very close to both the Imperial Palace and its gardens but also Tokyo Station for easy access to explore other parts of Tokyo.

We stayed one night while passing through Tokyo. This was our third stay at the Ascott Marunouchi and it was still as good as the first time we stayed. Staff were very polite and helpful. The location is great as it is either one stop by underground (Otemachi Station) or a 5-10 minute walk on foot from the Marunouchi exit of the Tokyo Station. The apartment was spacious, light and the bed was very comfortable with beautiful linen. It is great having a washing machine within the apartment. The bathroom is lovely and the products are luxurious. We used the indoor pool which is on the 22nd floor and has great views of Tokyo. Definitely plan on staying here when we are next in Tokyo and would highly recommend it.

perfect location with helpful and friendly staff. Very welcoming atmosphere. The room is exceptionally clean and well-furnished with everything you need, you just feel like home staying here. very likely to stay again

We were looking for a serviced residence near Tokyo Station that was well-rated and had direct access to the subway. Since this was just one stop away (Otemachi) and we had a good deal as an Ascott member, it was a straightforward decision to stay here.While we expect a certain standard from Ascott, the property still surprised us on the upside - great service from the staff and a wonderfully appointed and spacious room (with a fantastic bed) really helped us to end our holiday on a high note.Thank you so much for the experience!

stayed for a night before we departed to Lake Karuizawa and returned for another 3 nights. was glad we did ans we enjoyed the vast spacious lobby and sitting lounge and the one bedroom apartment. place is clean and feels comfortable. staff are definetly polite and helpful and eager to please. booked restaurants through them and the assistance extended is impressive !!! looking forward to a return visit.

Hotel is located at center of Tokyo, most of major tube stop at Otemachi station which is very close to the hotel. Very clean and big room. There was a laundry machine which was easy to use. I will stay this hotel next time.

The rooms and building are exceptionally beautiful. Just note this is not truly a hotel. I'd consider it more of a high-end residential building. Therefore, there is not a typical lobby and hotel staff. It was hard to find the entrance. Even the taxi driver from the trains station had trouble. Hence my rating of 3/5. Otherwise very nice. Expensive for the lack of standard features however, if I were having a longer stay - say 2 weeks or more I would certain stay here over a standard hotel. Rooms were very nice, shower and bathtub, full kitchen, large oversize windows, etc...

We stayed one night in the “Executive” and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The room did not have a view of any kind (disappointing) but was super comfortable and luxurious. You get free access to the pool and gym on the 22F. We didn’t try the restaurant; we prepared food in our kitchen so as to enjoy the room as much as possible. Our oven actually broke and couldn’t be fixed, though I doubt this is usual(?). Overall, a great relaxing place to stay but remember it is a residence and not a hotel.

I simply cannot find anything to complain about. Many times I do not write reviews because I cannot decide between 4 and 5 but this is a pure 5. Size of the room, places to put clothes and bags, kitchen, bed comfort, amenities' variety and quality, air conditioning, sound isolation were all good. Amenities and towels were replaced daily. Actually I was storing back the towels and there was no need to replace them daily. They were also changing the sheets daily. Thinking back maybe there was a paper to put on top of the bed, but had not noticed back then.Cleanness was top, though other places we stayed in Japan also had high hygiene standards. Even much more expensive hotels elsewhere in the world were nowhere near this cleanliness level.Our room was on one of the top floors. This was the best view of the city. I had been to a number of other recommended locations, but this was actually way better. Our room was facing the imperial gardens and then the rest of the city and one day we could even see mount Fuji. But even without this element the hotel would have been best one I've stayed in so far. It is sad that the restaurant does not have the view.Service was also very good taking into account these are served apartments. At the lobby floor there is also a foreign exchange machine. It does not have the best rates (around 5% above the rates in exchange offices of Japanese banks), but can be convenient.Location-wise: it is in the business district with lots of cafes and restaurants, especially on the ground and underground floors of the building nearby. Marounochi station is closeby. It is also close to shopping areas, but is still some distance from the main shopping areas and/or touristic places. But I have an impression you do have to walk a lot in Tokyo anyways due to big distances between public transportation stops or use taxi/uber.What can be improved:The only thing that comes to my mind variety and quality of black teas could be better. They offer a good Darjeeling, but Darjeeling is not my favourite.

Perfect location, and very good services. All of my requests have been realized, such as room with Fuji mountain view... This has made my stay wonderful. Also the hotel staffs are very nice, even prepared a lovely gift to me on my birthday. Though it is not expensive, it's out of my expectation and felt warm.

This residence is reasonably big esoecially the luxurious bathroom. The kitchenette is very impressive; they provide us with an oven and not just microwave so we were able to grill some fish. Housekeeping has excellent service. Really enjoy our stay!

The washer + dryer is very useful and efficient. Although I did not use the stove for cooking, the kitchenware and refrigerator are well appreciated, as I bought fruits, yoghurt, and juice in the department store food hall and the nearby convenience store. The wooden-screen divider between bedroom and living room is very stylish; at night, when I stayed in living room to work and had the light on, it did not disturb my son who was sleeping inside. There is a restaurant street located at B1 level of the office building (to which this apartment occupied 22/F to 27/F), one convenience store as well. Breakfast was good, both the conventional western-style breakfast as well as Japanese (miso soup, seaweed slices, congee). Front desk staffs are all friendly and helpful.

It was my wife’s 30 years old birthday and I wanted to make the stay memorable to her. We could enjoy our stay more than we expected. Room’s condition was well enough. Overall interior and atmosphere was great. Staff’s service was professional and kind.

The actual property is good, rooms are spacious and I had no problem with the check in, check out and actual stay of my recent trip. The problem lies with the instructions front desk provided for travel to Haneda airport. I enquired front desk as to best method to go to Haneda airport and the attendant they told me the easiest way would be by metro. He explained to me it would be 1 change at Mitai station and I should take the red line train to the "end of the line" where I would be at Haneda airport, he said the trip would take 40mins. He also drew arrows on the metro map which indicated the starting station, changeover station and an arrow going all the way to the end of the red metro line with a star to alight at the last station. The following morning, I departed an extra 30mins early to ensure there would be no issues on the way. At the Mitai station there are actually 2 different (trains - 1 local which requires another change at the next station or the Haneda express airport train - however this was NOT explained by the front desk staff). In order to make sure we were going on the train for the airport I checked with the station attendant who confirmed I can take the next train which was a local train which would go to the airport. However, he did not say there would be another change over required and because I had been told there would be only ONE changeover, we stayed on the train for a further 3 stops until a train conductor kindly told us we should go back to to Sengakuji station to take the Haneda express. This confusion led me and my travel companion to miss our flight at Haneda airport and incur $2,500 in additional cost to re-book the flights. I contacted the hotel to request a full or partial compensation, or some type of resolution to this terrible experience. I received an phone call asking why I didn't call the hotel when I became lost (I was not aware that I was on the wrong train until the conductor told us to "go back" at which point we were definitely late so we were running and the Tokyo metro has signs saying "turn off phone when crowded" and no one was talking so we were not sure if it was allowed), and then the manager of the hotel told me it was my fault and the fault of the train attendant that we became lost. I also received an email from the manager offering no resolution with no responsibility taken for the poor directions of the front desk staff. I am still waiting for a satisfactory reply.

hotel locates nearby the subway station with very nice enviornment around, no hurries and not crowded, very relax, facilities in. room is good for me to cook for self and the washing machine helps me a lot.

This was our second visit to Japan and decided to stay in Tokyo for about 8 days. We had previously stayed at the Palace Hotel which was very impressive and we enjoyed the area enough to stay close by. That's when we came across the Ascott Marunouchi Hotel. It was fairly new so some of the taxi drivers weren't familiar with the hotel since it sits at the top portion of a high rise building. However, it's a gem given it's amenities and modern finishes, it feels like your own apartment. Our room had a kitchen with a washer/dryer and truly made our experience feel as though we were at home. The staff helped arrange numerous reservations for us as well as Sumo tickets which is a must if you travel while tournaments are in place. Altogether, I highly recommend this hotel. It's close enough to Ginza and other main attractions but tucked away in the business district allowing for a peaceful stay.

This will be a lengthy one.The fact that Marunouchi is inhabited with a number of excellent, if not ultra-luxurious hotels, Ascott's presence in this district offers the kind of hospitality every traveler (event those who have experienced opulent service) need: straight-forward, non-intrusive and convenient.Very convenient I must add, as the Otemachi station is directly connected by a discreet door on the Ground Floor of the building, which connects you to virtually anywhere (we frequent the Marunouchi, Hanzomon and Chiyoda lines), on-the-go restaurants and convenient stores are also lined up all through the connecting passage ways.A beautiful 10-minute walk, through beautiful stores such as Tomorrowland, Comme des Garcons, Beams, Marimekko, and a stop by at Dean & Deluca takes you to Tokyo station for you to board on Shinkansen.Ginza is only 15-minute walk away. Walk it, I say, through the beautiful convention building, stop by Shake Shack, I cannot stress enough that Ascott Marunouchi's location is brilliant. Imperial Garden is it's backyard - nothing beats that.We. Got. Very. Lucky. I don't know how the hotel's management will respond to this review, but at the end of the day, I just want to share and thank them for confirming that there is an actual upgrade jackpot.It was my brother and I who were traveling, so I booked a One-Bedroom Apartment just to have some more space (that is the separate living room) just so we don't have to stand in each other's way for the 9 days we were about to spend in the same room. We booked way early.We checked in at around 9PM and were told that we were being downgraded to a Studio Apartment for the first night. As I went straight to complaint mode, the manager on duty explained that in return for the first night downgrade, we will be upgraded to a Two-Bedroom Executive Apartment, not only for the following night, but for the following nightS. Plural. Rest of the stay. I did not want to believe it until I saw it myself, but it happened. It was the second biggest room in the hotel.The Studio Apartment we spent on the first night was great. Great size, great bathroom, great kitchenette, great washer and dryer, great lighting, great Nespresso machine, great view of the garden, great value, great.But as we stepped into the Two-Bedroom Executive, great became fabulous. My brother and I got one bedroom, one bathroom, each. Extra spacious kitchen, wonderful dining and living area. Two people, three television.I calculate my travels mainly in two variables: how many times I say wow, and square meter. This establishment fulfilled both.I would like to personally thank you the Ascott Marunouchi Team for the generosity and hospitality. I'm checking all the good boxes here, and may I just say these two controversial words:Book direct.PS: We did not care about views so much UNTIL we stayed at the Marunouchi area, so do ask before booking or upon check-in. It changes the whole game.

I would like to thank the management for taking initiative for making our request come true.I wanted to give the best experience to my wife on our last night and the view was gorgeous to begin with and it was a pleasant stay, service was simple, straightforward and nice as we weren't too picky.I would like to come back again. Thank you so much to the team at Ascott Marunouchi Tokyo for our wonderful stay with you.

I have stayed at many hotels in tokyo and this is by far, the worst experience every dealing with the front desk. No wonder all the bad reviews of this place is all about the Front Desk. Shame on these people. They we’re literally unwilling to call the restaurant for us to make a lunch reservation because we were checking out on the day itself (we asked them to book 2 days before our check out date). “Sorry but we can only help you with reservations during your stay” with a fake grin on his face. Completely unheard of even in a 3 star hotel. What’s so hard about making a 30 second phone call for a customer that has been living there for almost 2 weeks? We don’t speak Japanese and needed someone to make the reservation for us. A janitor would probably be happy to help us, but not the front desk. It’s baffling to know a newly built 5 star service apartment would do such a thing. Not sure what’s their intention, but definitely felt like they were doing it on purpose because were tourists. But shouldn’t you assist them more knowing that we are tourists?? Ritz, four seasons, boutique hotels and even transit hotels would be happy to assist you with this very simple request, but not The ASScott. Yes it’s a new building, yes rooms are decent, but don’t be surprised to have a hard time dealing with the front desk if you are staying here. This is just ONE of the MANY negative experience in our 2 week stay here. Have us 12pm late check out and anything later would be a full nights charge. Needed to print a new itenary for visiting family’s visa document but was again reluctantly to do so. Housekeeping did not replenish amenities and did not clean utensils well. List goes on and on... feels like I’m in a 5 star building with a motel like service. Very unwelcoming and unhelpful. Never again and a huge mistake staying here.FYI - it wasn’t a Michelin star restaurant or anything that we wanted to make a reservation on. Just a casual sukiyaki and shabu-shabu place.

Spent a week in Tokyo and the Ascott could not have been a better choice for us.. amazing location with Tokyo subway station attached- so you don’t have to go outside if you don’t want to!! 10 minute walk to Tokyo station or one stop on subway. Tons of shops and restaurants within a few minutes walk- or subway ride.. lobby area is beautiful- coffee/espresso machine in lobby for guests available 24hrs a day- bottles water available at front desk all day. Suites are beautiful- we booked the second level suite- one bedroom suite- which is really a junior suite- comes with a nicely appointed kitchen with a small oven, full refrigerator, dishwasher, Nespresso machine, and stocked with pots/pans, flatware, and dishes. Allowed us to make breakfast most days, a dinner or two and a few cocktail hours- which really helped save some Money in this city.. There is a washer/dryer which is really easy to use (use google translate to figure out Japanese symbols)- awesome treat for us on a 7 night stay... bathroom is great- best water pressure I’ve ever had in a hotel- with a smart shower/bathtub room- large tub- I’m 6’3” and was very comfortable able to fully extend my legs- which rarely happens! Best part of the suite- the bed!! Amazing bedding and the bed itself is firm and perfect!! Tons of storage- so if you are visiting for a while- this suite is perfect!! Several closets, storage drawers everywhere..Daily housekeeping is included- website states no cleaning on Holidays and Sundays however we received cleaning every day including a National Holiday and a Sunday... and it is amazing housekeeping!!! They cleaned the suite top to bottom every day!!!Absolutely recommend this property- great value (we paid roughly $300 USD when many other 5 star properties were priced between $500-$650 a night) very comfortable, and great location makes the Ascott

Awesome housekeeping service - i really appreciated their efforts! what i like about is the equipped kitchen and washing machine, together made your travel fun with homey feel - ideal for long or short stay.

Perfectly located for eating places stations etc.The accommodation was the highlight of our stay.Reception could not have been more charming or helpful.. everyone looked up smiled and said hello...Excellent free espresso in the lounge area.Beautiful art work everywhere ...One of the most tastefully appointed hotels we have stayed in.The room too was beautifully appointed. fine china, great bedding... excellent lighting in the room... really well thought out.This will be our hotel of choice next visit.Quite outstanding!

We spent 4 nights here when we visited our son in Tokyo. The apartments is a short cab ride from the main station and you take the lift up to the foyer. The apartments are lovely - spacious, beautifully decorated and well planned. Very comfortable bed and the washing machine/dryer was welcome after about 10 days of travel. Lots of hanging and shelf space and lovely bathroom. Breakfast is fine - but no expresso coffee which was a bit disappointing as we do not want eggs or other cooked food but just a good coffee and toast in the morning. There is a Tullys coffee shop in the arcade under the hotel and another in a nice bakery a short walk away. Staff are very helpful. Good gym (especially for Tokyo).Good wifi.

The hotel is well-located in Marunouchi. It is good for business. However, it runs like a serviced apartment, so there is very limited service. Nothing in the mini-bar. The breakfast is also very basic.

We had booked 3 1 bedroom deluxe apartments at this hotel. We loved the stay away from the hustle and bustle of Tokyo yet we were right in the middle. The apartment was luxurious. we cooked our own breakfast. the station is below the hotel but its a good decent walk to the actual platform. The main Tokyo station is a leisure 15min walk.I would recommend staying here if you get a good deal otherwise it can very expensive to stay. Look out at their website during off-peak seasons.

Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of a 2-week trip and it was exactly what we needed. The apartment we booked was a studio (for 2 people) and larger than expected. The bathroom was spacious and extremely modern, the kitchenette was ideal for short stays (even had a dishwasher). The washer/dryer worked well and a small package of detergent was provided by housekeeping daily.The best part about the room... the view. We were on the 27th floor (Rm 2702) and got to wake up to see a beautiful view of Tokyo (including Mt Fuji in the background). Lovely sunsets as well. The bathroom has a large window (with a shade you can close) that allows you to stand in the shower and look out as well, nice little touch - makes it feel more luxurious.The hotel itself is brand new (and just celebrated it's 1 year anniversary), very tastefully decorated - and though tends to cater to those traveling for business, was absolutely perfect for vacationing as well. Note that the hotel does have a restaurant but it's only open during the week and there is no room service or bar. The lobby is a beautiful, double-height space on the 22nd floor (the entire hotel is perched at the top of a business tower) and has access to a small pool and a decently equipped gym.Everything was extremely clean and spotless. Housekeeping did a lovely job keeping our room clean and there was no conflict with arriving back to maids in the room, it was always complete when we returned.The area is a business area, but the metro is located just steps from the hotel entrance. Lots of good food options within a 10-min walk so don't let the area deter you. It was very quiet at night, and very safe.HIGHLY RECOMMEND if you're looking for something different or ending a long trip in Tokyo (staying in a beautiful hotel and being able to do your laundry is a thing of beauty).

Stayed at Ascott Marunouchi Tokyo for 3 nights really worth of what I paid for! All services provided were truly efficient. Staff are super friendly. Love the ambience of the room which fully equipped with the facilities.

For Tokyo standards a nice spacious apartment. The Metro line is downstairs with connections to all parts of Tokyo. I recommend this place for travellers with children who would like some more space and don’t necessarily need to be in the middle of the hustle. Easy to get to other parts of Tokyo to visit points of interest and plenty of amenities around for a quick drink/dinner.

Very impressed with this service apartment style hotel. I booked two nights for business since the place I normally stay was booked. In my experience, most service apartment properties slightly skimp on the finer details found at luxury hotels, like lobby and fittings - but not here. Fit and fittings are top notch, rivaling luxury hotel chains. Exceptionally clean and perfect location just next to train station and palace park. Friendly service. If any fault, I would say the breakfast could use help. I would skip that and venture out to one of the many nearby cafes.

Location of this property is just next to Otemachi station where there is a labyrinth of restaurants in the underground.Stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment, which was good for our stay in Tokyo. Noticed that the crockeries & cutleries in the room were good quality and the washer was very quiet when in use.The staff were all very pleasant and helpful.The gym and restaurant looks good.Will definitely choose this for our next trip

An Amazing property to stay in. The rooms are exceptionally good and the staff is extremely courteous, polite and helpful. The overall service is excellent. I would highly recommend this property to everyone visiting Tokyo.

The simple entrance to Ascott Marunouchi serves to surprise one as the elevator doors open to the lobby. Tasteful and elegant and welcoming to guests. The one bedroom suites are spacious, Uber clean, and comfortable such that you actually feel bad about leaving the room to explore the city. Friendly and helpful staff. Will definitely stay here again.

The room was fine but i was expecting a bigger room that is why i paid more money to stay at this hotel. The breakfast was below average for a Japanese hotel. Other than that, other things were quite nice. The location was great. Many restaurants nearby.

Hong Kong, Hong Kong

review_body: This is an excellent option for business travellers for the Otemachi and Nihombashi areas. Room size is very good, and well maintained. Note that there is no room service. Conveniently located at Otemachi station, so access to several subway lines is very easy.

1) Strategically located at the Otemachi Park Building, served by a comprehensive network of at least 5 subway lines. It is about 750m walking distance to Tokyo Station.2) The Deluxe one-bed room which I occupied was clean, comfortable, comes with a fully functional kitchen. The bathroom and toilet was huge.3) Housekeeping standard was good, comparable to that of 5-star hotel. Thank you to the fabulous and meticulous housekeeping team for the good job done.4) All the staff were very polite, helpful and patient. Both check-in and check-out experience was excellent.5) There are many good restaurants at B1 of Otemachi Park Building.I wish to take this opportunity to thank Santoshi at the front desk who was most helpful with giving me advice on how to get to Ikebukoru from Otemachi via the Marunouchi line. And thank you to the staff (did not get his name) who helped me with my luggage from my room all the way to ground floor on the morning I checked out. I will definitely return to this lovely and awesome home away from home in Tokyo.

My husband (32) and I (30) stayed here for eight nights and had the best time. We had a studio apartment with an amazing view- room 2703. The king sized bed was extremely comfortable. The entire apartment was very clean and new. We did not use the washer/dry or any of the kitchen like we had planned but its was great the have the option. It was great to have a refrigerator as well. We had breakfast at Triple One (the in house restaurant) daily and it great food. We also had lunch here once and the food was great. We particularly enjoyed the chef (can't remember his name) and server Josline. Staff was great! The gym was perfect and never busy. There is free wifi in the apartment and you just have to ask the front desk for the password to use the wifi in the lobby and gym. There is free coffee and water in the lobby. There is a little rooftop terrace off of the lobby that is great as well. The imperial palace is less than 5 min walk. We walked to Toyko Station several times, about 10 minutes. Taxi drivers did not have any difficulty finding the hotel for us, we only speak English so before we left I printed out copies of the hotel's address in Japanese and we had zero issues. Most of the staff was fluent in English and we had no communication issues at all.

We will have a great team that offers our services and feel welcome and appreciated throughout the vacation, and we will definitely book again and highly recommend anyone looking for the best service and feel comfortable during their stay.

If you're looking for flawless staff, gorgeous rooms, luxury amenities & impeccable housekeeping - look no further! This property offers fully-stocked apartments complete with washer/dryers. We were totally comfortable throughout our stay! Apartments were spotless & beds were super large & comfortable!

Clean, fully equipped as if it’s a hotel room. Service was good- I didn’t have high expectations bc it’s not a hotel but the staff helped us with luggage, helped us find cabs, recommended restaurants. I wish I had stayed here instead of wasting my money at the 4 Seasons in Tokyo. Far better amenities, and hardware.

Situated within walking distance of Tokyo station, the Ascott is a great place to stay when on business or holiday. The rooms are well kitted out and the presentation is excellent.Did not have the time to try out the gym or the pool. Breakfast was good.Staff were very attentive, yet non-intrusive and always attempting to please.On the whole a great experience.

Came to hotel in the morning for check in. Shocked to be given a room with absolutely no view, just the rooftop of the building. Perhaps I was travelling with children and wouldn't mind about it? Disappointed to know the pool was only for 16yr and above. Didn't have a good experience checking out either. The lady handling it was cold and unfriendly. Perhaps they only cater for VIP clients? But that aside, rooms are good and sizable.

Called to get a copy of the invoice for my stay and was told that this was not possible because I booked through an OTA. Entire situation was handled very poorly with no solutions offered. While the property itself was well maintained, I would not recommend staying at this property due to poorly trained staff and poor reservation tracking systems.

New York City, New York

review_body: For Tokyo, this hotel was absolutely good value for money. The rooms were spacious and well-maintained (and very new, I think). There were some funkier appliances like hot plates and a washer - so I think the hotel is geared more as an apartment-style short-to-medium stay residence.The location could have been slightly better since the lines connecting to the Otemachi Station is not the best, but Tokyo Station is only a short walk away. But overall, it's still very convenient.Will definitely be coming back!

Nothing small about the rooms here. A good sized bedroom with a bench kitchen and washing machine above a railway station. Make sure you get a room with a park view.Really good gym, swimming pool and you get a buffet breakfast with western and Japanese food . Everything works.

Located in the business area of Tokyo, a few meters away from the subway station, this hotel is actually located on the 22nd floor and up. Entrance and reception are beautiful, staff very professional and dedicated. Room was amazing, huge and arrange with style. Modern, luxurious, separated living room and bedroom, washing machine and kitchen. It felt more like an apartment rather than a hotel room. Amazing swimming pool ans nice restaurant. Overall a very good experience, we will absolutely go back to this hotel next time we are in Tokyo. We recommend this establishment absolutely as it matched our need completely.

We stayed st Ascott Tokyo for 5 nights. The apartment is very well decorated and model. Super clean. With good view of Tokyo city. Very convenient. It is linked to subway station and walking distance to Major shopping district and imperial garden. Staff are Friend and speak good English. Highly recommend.

Could not fault this apartment hotel not far from Tokyo Station. We loved everything about it. We had a corner studio on the 28th floor with spectacular views over the Imperial Palace Gardens, the Tokyo skyline and Mt Fuji in the distance. As well as the beautiful modern decor, the kitchen and washer/dryer make it an ideal place to stay and so spacious compared to most Japanese hotels. It is in the business district, so quiet at night but the subway Otemachi is right at the entrance to the hotel so it is easy to get to the lively areas of Tokyo. Staff were exceptional.

We had a lovely Corner room (studio) on the 28th floor and there is nothing to complain about! I can highly recommend Ascott Marunouchi as a hotel to stay in Tokyo and its amazing apartments. Located in Tokyo city centre it offers top standard facilities and splendid views from its huge windows.

I really don't have anything bad to say about this place - beautiful apartments - spacious, modern and luxurious, immaculately clean, comfy beds, all the amenities you need, great location, great staff. We stayed 3 nights when we first arrived in Japan and found it very comfortable, easy to find as it's a 10 minute walk from Tokyo main station and it's great having the kitchen area as it meant we could bring all sorts of snacks in from the fab shops in the city and eat them comfortably in the room. There is a good swimming pool and gym on site and if you do want to have breakfast at the hotel you can pay extra and have it in their restaurant if you want. Highly recommended and really good value for money.

The location very close to Otemachi Station (Marunouchi Line Tokyo)I ask for top floor room and the view was wonderful. In the morning you can see the scene of wonderful tokyo and Mt. FujiThe bathroom was huge and the bed were very comfortable with lots of pillows (my fave)The room service and housekeeping doing a great job to serve my needs like a bucket of ice, request for extra blanket, extra pillow.

I stayed her for four nights on my first visit to Tokyo. The hotel is very modern and plush which you notice as soon as you enter the Level 22 main lobby (although a bit lacking at street level with no staff to greet nor much of a driveway). Staff are very friendly and greet you everytime you walk past the reception desk which is everytime you come and go from the hotel. Given it is a sky lobby, it did become a bit of a pain to have to change lifts each time you wanted to leave the hotel and the lifts aren’t near each other. I had a 1br apartment on Level 27 and the view over the Imperial Gardens towards Shibuya/Shinjuku was amazing. On a clear day you can see Mt Fuji which was a novelty. The apartment itself is very spacious with kitchen incl dishwasher, laundry facilities, generous sized bathroom and King size bed. The room is very modern and very comfortable except a more comfy armchair would have completed this. The hotel location was convenient for Metro transport (connected to Otemachi station which is the main Metro interchange) although note it is still quite a walk to some Metro lines albeit underground and well signposted (in English) signage. The location is a downside as well being in Maranouchi which is the Financial District and not a lot of food or entertainment options nearby. There is also no room service in the hotel which adds to the location issue. The indoor Pool was fantastic and a very comfortable temperature. Overall I loved the hotel and would recommend to anyone with the caveat about being mindful of the location with what you are wanting to get out of your Tokyo stay.

Nice location and great service but they don't have spa . I enjoy with yoga classes and the concierge prepared all what do you need it and you will like it and love it and don't forget going to ginza zone.

I like their Location, its near every place in Tokyo. And staffs has very good attitude of their job. Room was very clean. Their was cutlery in the room, I could understand what is that for. But I was so disappointed with their Breakfast. First you have to bring your breakfast voucher, when you want have breakfast. (I didn't bring it so I paid it twice.) And food quality was not that expected too.

We chose this hotel based on price and reviews and we were so happy we did. The room was extremely large, especially by Tokyo standards, with a nicely equipped kitchen and washer/dryer. The bed was comfortable and the AC was excellent. It is located minutes from 3 metro stations, so we didn't mind being a little off the beaten tourist path. The staff at the front desk and in the restaurant were helpful and friendly, making us reservations, calling cabs, etc. We enjoyed the variety of the buffet breakfast in the dining room. The hotel is a part of an office complex, so there are also lots of other food options nearby. The only thing I found strange was that the restaurant was closed for dinner on Saturday night. I would happily stay here again!
