Pegstra
New York City, New York

review_body: Absolutely phenomenal serviced appartment couple of minutes of a nice walk from the Tokyo Station. Undergorund station directly at the hotel entrance. Professional and polite staff prepared to respond to all wishes of the hotel guests - they helped us a lot ot send our luggage via Taqubin, recive some packages etc.Spacious rooms with wooden floor, large bathrooms, great kitchen, well equipped appartmens with everything you need.Absolute perfection.One picture is worth thousand words - I am unable to praise more this hotel, so just go there and check it by yourself. :-)Note: 1.) No possibility to open the windows2.) Children under 18 y are not permitted to use the swimming pool. What a pity for my 3,5 years old daughter - I promised her the pool. :-(

Well equipped kitchen and laundry. Convenient location and nearby Otemachi Station. 24hr gym (well equipped) in the building. Restaurant options in the basement of the (left) building next door. However, better options available about 10 - 15mins down the road in Marunouchi area. However, Guest Services needs improvement:- Reception asked me to bring my own dry cleaning down instead of collecting it from my room.- housekeeping only able to replace amenities (shower caps) after 12pm l.- Shampoo, shower gel, coffeee etc are a “once off” and won’t be replaced. Even if you’re staying for a month. - Guest Services don’t show you to your room nor offer to assist with baggage. Having visited Japan on a regular basis for 6 years, I feel the Guest Services team doesn’t meet what is expected of “Japanese hospitality and service.” However, the location of the building and convenience of a long term stay options as a Serviced Apartment makes Ascott Marunouchi a place I’d return to but the Service is very disappointing.

Have travelled widely and can honestly say this is one of my top three hotel experiences anywhere. Faultless service, warm, welcoming and efficient. So tranquil it’s hard to believe you’re in the heart of one of the world’s busiest cities. Pristine, luxurious, ulra-modern apartment apparently serviced by invisible pixies who never disturbed us. Great restaurant food. Superb, central location, just a few minutes from the Imperial Palace Gardens. Lots of additional restaurants in the basement station walkway. Tokyo is not a cheap city to visit, but the Ascott was considerably better value than some of the more well-known high-end hotels. Stayed with my husband and two teenage children. All four of us raving about it ever since. Can’t recommend highly enough!

Excellent stay on top of the Otemachi subway, near tokyo station in Maranouchi district. For strictly tourist purposes, it would be better to stay in a less business-y area but for quality of the apartment and convenience on top of the subway lines, this suited our family well.

This is my 2nd time staying at Ascott Marunouchi. I stayed the first time in August last year, when they were still brand new and now they are celebrating their 1st year anniversary. I really enjoyed staying at this apartment. Clean, modern, well designed, and with good location. Very close to the nearest subway station which is connected to Tokyo Sta. Basically, you can go anywhere from there. The facility is good. 24Hr gym. A yoga class in the morning. The only downside perhaps, they do not have a limousine bus stop. However, you can walk to the nearest hotel which is really close.

We stayed here at the end of our March Break trip to Asia. The rooms are small but very well kept. The small kitchenette is a nice touch. Lunch is very reasonably priced. The hotel is in a great location to attractions and the subway. There is no bar which is too bad and they could use a small / quick Cafe. The gym is very well equipped but the pool is too small to be worthwhile.

I was initially scared that being an apartment rather than a hotel room it would not be nice but I was totally wrong. The bathroom was large and of course Japan toilets are the latest spec. They also had all complimentary items such toothbrush etc.. and by the L'Occatiane brand which is excellent.The bedroom "section" looks stunning and the full windows give a great view of Tokyo. The 4K tvs are all perfect and the Wifi was very quick. (You actually connect to your own apartments router which makes its easier) . I have many gadgets and phones that needed to be charged and each socket in the bedroom area had two USB charging ports which was superb, I didn't need to use any silly adapters which as we know are never quite right.The kitchen I never used as I was on a business trip but it all looked state of the art. The hotel itself is above a business building with its own lift and entrance at the front, I actually walked from the Tokyo station even in rush hour with a trolley bag it took 10 minutes (most of the time is waiting at lights to cross) Location wise, you have the imperial palace within 5 minutes, main station within 10 and if you walk 15mins your into Ginza which has the upmarket shops. Underneath the building via the subway connections you have a variety of restaurants.Check in was very quick, just be aware you need to take your bags to your room (not an issue if your a business traveller) and the breakfast was surprisingly good, though not as much variety as 5* hotels but easily enough to be happy with. Overall the hotel is stunning as its brand new and has the latest tech and very close to main sites of Tokyo. Would I come back again, yes definitely.

Stayed in a one bedroom appartment up on the 26th floor, and it seemed pretty heavenly to me!! Soooo quiet and restful, and the housekeeping staff were so discreet that you could have slept through the whole day and not been disturbed.The kitchen had every appliance/utensil you could think of, and there was a small dining area plus lounge with TV and sofa, in addition to the TV in the bedroom, a few metres away. I mean, wow!!!Breakfast was an additional 7,000 yen for two, but it was to die for!!! Tropical fruit salad, cereals, eggs, noodles (for my partner!), toast, waffles and cinnanmon whirls, in that order, hardly needed to eat for the rest of the day!! Lovely staff as well, the chef overseeing proceedings was so polite and welcoming, they all were, could've stayed here forever, sigh!

We travelled as a couple during New year vacation for 5 days. The location was a bit far from the metro station. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The room was large and fully equipped. Quality of sleep was excellent.

Room Type: Premium 1-BedroomThe Good: - Huge 1-bedroom by Tokyo standard for the price with large living room and a fully equipped kitchen - 2 bathrooms with showers (1 bathtub) - Property is adjacent to subway (20m) - Lots of storage spacesThe Bad: - The view from my room is blocked by a large metal bar outside that runs across the building - Reception in on the upper floor and often time there is no one at the entrance on the 1st floor. So if you're hauling lots of luggages, might have to haul them up yourselfThe Noteworthy:  - Living room has a tatami area - While this area is full of office/government building, there's actually quite a few nice restaurants, high-end retail stores, and a walking street with artisans plying their trades on weekend - definitely worth a checking outThe Verdict: It might not feel as upscale as certain nearby 5 stars hotels costing 2-3 times as much, but it certainly is the best value for the money in the area (and better than a few other 5 stars hotels). I'd definitely consider staying here on a mid-to-long term basis.

Excellent location, right in the financial district of Tokyo. One block from the best designer shopping centers. Walking distance from the OEDO Antique Open Market Sunday morning-kimonos and much more-must go!!).5 min walk from Tokyo Station.The Apartments are spacious, contemporary but warmly decorated. They have all the amenities including kitchen, washer and dryer, tub and shower in the master bathroom, and a few closets to storage all your luggage and all your new acquisitions. I highly recommend this place.

The staff was fantastic, we even saw someone inspecting the housecleaning work. The view over the Imperial gardens with a view of Mt Fuji was the best I have seen in a long time. The room was very comfortable and modern and the location is perfect to explore Tokyo.

The apartment was spacious and clean. The view was great. They prepared the room to our special request of not using perfume in room and bed linens. There is a lot of restaurants around and metro is just outside the door. Would stay here again.

I have never written a review prior to staying at a hotel, but the customer service from the Ascott Tokyo has been exceptional so far. We emailed a few times with some special requests, and their responses have been both immediate and extremely positive.This really is causing us to anticipate an exceptional stay later this month.

Before we decided to book the hotel, we were a little worried over the comments that the place is a little quiet at night and restaurants close early. We took a taxi to the hotel from Tokyo Station, at first the driver was unsure where is the hotel and had to ask around. We were then directed to the lower ground drop off point of the hotel which is unusual for any hotel entrance(later on we figured that if the driver is unsure of the hotel location, just tell them it is at Otemachi building, it worked for us for a few times and they dropped us at the front entrance). Check in was fast and we were given complimentary breakfasts for the duration of our stay. The staff were courteous and helpful with our luggages.The unit (I booked 2 bedrooms unit) is awesome! Its like a new condo with really nice furniture. There is even a washing machine and a dryer in the unit. The kitchen is fully equipped (microwave, oven, washer, Nespresso, fridge, cutleries, pots and pans, knives - you name it, they have it covered!) Its really nice because we were travelling with a toddler and that means, I can cook proper meal for the toddler rather than buying convenient food. We also checked out the facilities - the gym and the gym pool. The pool is rather small but cant expect much for a indoor gym pool on 22nd floor. Everything about this hotel exude luxuries and elegance. Actually there are many restaurants surrounding the hotel. Right next to hotel entrance - there is another entrance that connects to the offices. You take the escalator to B1 and there are so many restaurants underground. The sushi bar was quite good, you may need to queue up if you are late. The underground also connects you to the Otemachi train station.If you walk few blocks, there is this row of restaurants underneath a bridge (i think its called Kitchen Street if not mistaken). Most of the office workers will patron there and the foods are quite good.During the day, you can check out the Imperial East Garden and the Palace which is just nearby. There are a few small shopping malls around ( but we took the train to Ginza so I dont know much about the malls nearby) We will definitely come back to this hotel in future if we travel to Tokyo.

First of all I want to thank all the staff at Ascott for a wonderful stay for me and my wife The hotel is located very near to the imperial palace and it is located at the business area of Tokyo. You can actually walk (about 20-30 minutes) to Ginza , also the hotel has been operational for only about a year so everything is spotless and new The hotel is located at the top floors of an office building and has its own lift to the reception area at the 22nd floor We took a one bedroom apartment which was very spacious especially in a city so crowded like Tokyo The view from the hotel was good as you can see the skyline of Tokyo The room had a suitable kitchen with two electric burners , a small oven/microwave, frig, a small dishwasher and a good size washing/drying machine The bathroom was large and the sitting area had a couch and two seat dining table. The hotel has also a plan for long stay and prices will go down for surePlease note that there is only one restaurant in the hotel which serves three meals but frankly there are enough food and restaurants around the area which you can choose from , I mean almost any kind of food you want . Next time when I go to Tokyo I will definitely stay at this hotel for the price location and size you cannot beat this hotel

This turned out to be the perfect hotel for us for 6 days in Tokyo.We love the location being very central and convenient for catching the subways in all direction. It's also directly connected to Haneda airport in a 45 minute ride.Everything works perfectly in the room, bath, sitting area as well as the kitchenette and laundry. It has lots of storage and closets to pur away everything during our stay. The extra space and sitting area turns out to be very relaxing also.One of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed!

We stayed in the hotel for 5 days/4 nights in an Executive 1 Bedroom on the 28th floor. Our initial booking was for a studio but we decided to upgrade because we found the room a bit tight for 3 people ( 2 adults and a 14 year old teen).The hotel is newly refurbished, modern and stylish for a service apartment. Rooms are well appointed and bathrooms are big for Japanese standards.The only downside as the service. It took them atleast 30 mins and 2 follow up phone calls to get extra towels, robes and pillows for the 3rd person in the room. Then at one instance, the housekeeping knocked on our door and wheeled in a humidifier without any explanation even if we kept on saying we didn’t asked for one. On our last day, we had return tickets for the airport limousine to Narita but unfortunately Ascott Marunochi is not part of hotels the bus picks up from. Although the reception was kind enough to reconfirm reservations for the airport limo bus, the service ended there after checkout. We had 7 luggages ( 3 hand carries, 4 suitcases) and needed assistance to walk to the next street Palace Hotel where the airport pick up will be. We asked if a staff can accompany us with the trolley - the answer was no with the reason they were short on staff.We also asked if we can borrow the trolley ahead of time so we can drop off our luggage and return it after - the answer was still a no. The only solution they can offer was either walk with all your luggage to the next street or take a 2 minute cab ride.After spending $800 a night for a 4 night stay... the least they can at least do better with assisting their guests upon departure.

Ever stay at one of those hotels where you linger at the hotel room door on the day of departure because you love the room so much? This is that kinda place. Just top notch in every respect. I cannot imagine staying anywhere else .

Centrally located near the business area and bustle of Tokyo Station many restaurants and shopping. Ascott is barely one year old and showing lotsa depth. Lovely furnished rooms, amenities galore, service excellent and breakfast serving selected Singapore fare is welcomed! Art works adorn this residence and you gotta be mesmerised with its view.

We stayed for 10 days in Ascott Marunochi in March 2018. The apartments are new and quite excellent. Service was perfect and the staff very friendly. For the second half of our stay we got an upgrade and could enjoy the city view on the 29th floor. I personally like having breakfast in the apartment, so I do not know about the breakfast offered by the hotel. Tokyo station is close, and subway station is right below the hotel. We very much enjoyed staying in this hotel.

Excellent service apartment, good breakfast to start the day with. The rooms were very well furnished. Front office was very quick n helpful. Enjoyed my stay here. Highly recommended place to stay in Tokyo.

Excellent business hotel near Otemachi station. Area is very quiet at night. Appreciated friendliness of staff. Rooms were very spacious y Tokyo stds. Has everything u need, including laundry and self catering facilities. There is a Lawsons about 75m- really convenient for late night cravings while working. Gym was adequate. Pool was really only good for a dip. Thought breakfast could be better. Skipped it the sexing day.

I stayed in some apartments from the Ascott group before but this one is the only bad experience I had ever tried.My husband and I stayed in the 1-bedroom apartment from 11-14 Feb.Before checkin, I've tried to ask for help by email (in Japanese) about reserving table in a Kyobashi restaurant on the day of my departure. However, they haven't reply until I sent out a reminder email after 48hours to beg for their simple reply even if they can't help. Although I finally got my request done as their special grant, it didn't help as I feel really angry to be ignored by the hotel. Usually, I would receive reply from other hotels/apartment within 24-hour no matter successful or not.**SIMPLE REJECT EMAIL NEEDED MORE THAN 50HRS IS RIDICULOUS**During my 3-nights stays, I didn't receive any reminder/information about my restaurant booking so I decided not to use this hotel again and won't recommend it to my friends. Finally, I did heard a brief reminder at the lift lobby after checking out but my though for not coming back won't be changed.***DOES THE ASCOT DO CARE ABOUT THEIR GUESTS??? ***I don't think so. Even if the residence got luxury inside the room, it doesn't worth for 4.5 stars without any hospitality.In summary, If you just care about apartment design and facilities, okay you can stay but there are better option at surroundings.If you really decided to stay here, please don't try to make any request or you will be suffered.

My family of four stayed at Ascott Marunouchi Tokyo for four nights during the CNY holiday. We both loved their zen-like ambience and very modern and new amenities in the bathroom (and wash-let of course). It seems there were a lot of guests at the hotel during that time, however, it wasn’t noisy at all and we actually felt pretty private staying there. The restaurant “Triple One” is a gem! Do not miss it! We would recommend the lunch buffet or the Singaporean dinner course which we both tried. The food quality was excellent and the presentation was truly 5-star. The location is also a big plus as it is connected directly to metro (Otemachi Station, exit C6). Last but not least, excellent service of the hotel staff and all our questions and requests were managed above our expectations. We will be back!

The Ascott Marunouchi is a luxury hotel, which I did not know for reading other peoples' reviews of the place. The lobby is comfortable, the rooms are clean, the broadband is extremely high speed, the pool is actually one large glass aquarium, the shower/bath area is something I would like to build into a bathroom remodel at home one day, and the staff is very attentive. I travel a lot and am not too easily impressed, but these guys got it right. Congrats!

great location, access to shopping mall and to the tokyo central station directly from under the hotel, very clean spacious apartment, including everything needed, nice Tokyo and Fuji mountain view, great bathroom, great bed

This was the best property we stayed at while in Tokyo. We couldn't have been more impressed. Aside from getting in & out (2 different elevators) we were within walking distance to several convenience stores, Ginza, Palace gardens. This is down the street from the Palace hotel. The neighborhood is very quiet at night.

review_body: My husband and I decided to brave it and bring our young son and my mother in law on holiday to Tokyo this past week. We booked a two bedroom apartment thinking we could do with the extra space, knowing from previous experiences with hotel rooms in Tokyo that they tend to be rather small. We were so pleasantly surprised at the generous size of the apartment and the wonderful amenities it had been fitted with. The front desk staff were so helpful and friendly with all our restaurant and taxi bookings, it made travelling with our little guy much less stressful. I have been raving about the Ascott marunouchi to everyone since we’ve returned back home, and we will definitely stay there again the next time we’re in Tokyo.

Excellent accommodation; new interiors in the room; amazing views; great spacious rooms and toilets; great staff; had wonderful 4 nights ...excellent view of Tokyo city, Fuji, Tokyo tower from room...good gym...But... lack of options in breakfast....I’d have loved to rate it 6 star( I know I can’t) but lack of breakfast options dragged it to 5....

We chose this place as an cheaper alternative to our "usual" Capitol hotel.We had a large 80 sqm 1-bed executive apartment (couple travelling).Room is services daily, like a regular hotel).Brand new, large living/dining rooms, king bed, large bathroom with walk-in shower (Occitane amenities) and bath tub.Plenty of space. Fully equipped kitchen.Washing machine/dryer has to be requested prior to checkin as not all room have it.The place: 23-rd floor and up of modern office building. Only downside is, except underground, the neighborood is very quiet (dead), no restaurants, no shopping immediately nearby - but Otemachi is on 4 subway line, just below the hotel building, and Tokyo station is a 10-min walk.Only difference with a a hotel is limited dining option: breakfast is available (not tested, we cooked our own), only 1 restaurant of Asian/Singaporean style (as Ascott is owned by Singapore's CapitaLand) with limited options and opening times. No room service.Great place for travellers OK with staying in a business district in a soul-less (but spot-less and worry-less) flat and spend more time outside than inside the room.Also, always a concern in Japan, the entire place is non-smoking

The property is all new and nice. We stayed there for 5 nights from 12/28 to 1/03. We had stayed in many luxurious hotels in Japan from my many trips to the country. I have to say for the price that we paid, the service didn't match. You can receive much better service from other hotels nearby such as The Palace Hotel, The Imperial Hotel and Oakwood Premier.They were nice enough to give our kids birthday presents (a box of cookies) which we really do appreciate. There are two things that I would like to point out though:1. I had asked repeatedly whether we could borrow their cart to transport our luggage to Hoshinoya (a very nice hotel 5 min away by walkling) to take the limousine bus to Narita. There are a few carts always sitting there not being used. They just wouldn't let you. They had no means of trying to help you. The property has no direct limousine to the airports. I had stayed in other hotels that would really try to make it easy for you by helping you with luggage, Ascott just didn't care. On the day we left, there were two male and one female employee outside on the first floor. The female staff was very kind. The male staff were just helpless. I asked if either of them can help us with just 1 luggage to cross the street, one guy told me " you can just go to the street and try to find a taxi yourself" while the other one just stood there yawning. That's the kind of help we received after having spent USD $2,500 there. Obviously they didn't care and didn't see that we were travelling with two children and had 5 pieces of luggage all together.2. On the day we checked left, I asked the front desk if it's possible to change our bus reservation time from 11:15 to 1:20 PM. The lady in the front desk said she would call Hoshinoya and let me know. 30 minutes later, she called back and said the 1:20 bus was cancelled. This seemed very unlikely in Japan that limousine bus would cancel for no reason. Upon 10:45 we arrived at Hoshinoya to buy the bus tickets. I asked the male employee from Hoshinoya " Is the 1:20 bus to Narita cancelled?: He seemed very surprised and told me "No, it's not cancelled". At this point, I just was totally disappointed with the management and service of Ascott. Who should I believe? For the price that we paid, we could have chosen to stay at other luxurious hotels within the area. I would certainly try Hoshinoya next time we go back to Japan. When I walk in to buy the bus tickets, they really treated me with respect even though we were not hotel guests there. They way they welcomed you and helped you was very inviting.I had stayed in another serviced apartment hotels such as The Oakwood Premier. I have to say Oakwood excelled in every way. The location, the service and management. I would certainly stay there again if I was going to choose this type of accommodation.When you stay in Ascott, the general feeling that we get is they don't really care to go out of their way to help you. They do their basic stuff and that is all. If you are looking for service then I suggest The Imperial, Hoshinoya and The Palace Hotel. You will be much happier there.

Just a truly amazing hotel/apartment to stay at while in Tokyo! Very centrally located in the center of a very nice business district. The Ascott is right on top of a Metro station so you don't have to go far to catch a train. Interestingly enough you can walk underground from this station to Tokyo station, and vice versa. I wish I would of known that when we arrived! We stayed in a Studio and a 1 bedroom during our stay to try them both out. The Studio is plenty of space for 2 people. It has a kitchenette and a bathroom with a window that opens up into the main bedroom. If you need privacy there is a shade you can lower. The 1 bedroom is separated by a living room in the middle from the kitchen and bathroom areas. The shower in the 1 bedroom was my favorite, although I wish it had a window to the outside. Additionally the 1 bedroom had a Washer and Dryer combo unit in it. This was amazing because we could do our laundry before returning home. It was nice to pack another clean bag of clothes and not worry about it on our return. No bar here, except on the weekends. Easy to get to, great place to stay, worth your money if you want something cozy and nice. Way better than a loud hotel. However there is no bar. The pool here was pretty nice and the gym as well.

The location is quite good if not very. It is right above the exit C6 of Otemachi Station (on red metro line, one stop next to Tokyo station). Meanwhile, you can also walk to the Tokyo Station if you want (for different JR or Metro line) and you can choose to either walk there via underground (important during winter like us) or on the ground. It is also right next to Chiyoda Park (Palace I remember).This time, we stayed at 29/F, the top floor and with the Chiyoda Park view. It was amazing and we can even see the Mount Fuji from our room (though small one) !Due to the location, we even have a closer view than that from Aman Hotel behind us.We also tried out the gym when we stayed. Equipment is new and they cover all basic stuff you need too.Service and house keeping is good too. However, it would be great if they can offer shoe-shinning service too (like you can leave your shoes in the room and the hotel will help with it), especially it is a business hotel --- I visited park hyatt bangkok before, and they do offer this servcie, although the city is more for tourist.However, since the hotel located at the business area, not much local and small shop/resturant nearby at late night.Happ stay anayways :)

The apartment building is conveniently located between the Imperial Residence and Tokyo Station, on multiple metro lines. It's in a CBD area and therefore quiet on weekends/holidays. Our apartment was luxurious with a big bathroom, although the bedroom was a little small. Staff were helpful.

Great serviced apartment. Stayed in a 1 bedroom deluxe. The apartment was very well furnished with high quality appliances (stove, oven/microwave, washer/dryer) and was quite big for Tokyo hotel room standards. Service was also great.Location was also good. A 12-15 mins walk from Tokyo station (with 2 strollers) and directly above the Otemachi subway station. On weekdays there are a few restaurants downstairs as well as convenience store (one on B1 and another 24-hour one across the road).

We stayed for two nights but you could live here for a month. The apartment had a bed room and separate lounge, bathroom and kitchen/laundry that made good use of space and compared to some Tokyo accommodation we have had was spacious enough to feel you could live here for an extended stay. The furniture, fittings and inclusions were all high-end and while no where is cheap to stay in Tokyo we felt was good value for money. The apartment tower is a 10-15 minutes walk from Tokyo Station and if its cold you can can wind your way through the underground rabbit warren of the Tokyo subway. It is close to Marunouchi Nakadori with its interesting shops and night-time illuminations. Great spot and highly recommended.

We were amazed at the size of the Premier Room that we got, especially for the price we got on Expedia. We’ve been coming almost every year to Tokyo for the last 6 years, and this is the biggest room that we have had (we’ve stayed in Suites at the Capitol Tokyo, Conrad, Park Hyatt and Grand Hyatt Hotels in Tokyo). It also has a Tatami space that could fit in 2 mattresses, perfect for a family with 2 kids like us. 2 bathrooms, and the main En-suite bathroom is hugeService was professional and friendly. Rooms are well maintained, extremely clean and facilities in the room were good.The only downside is that it’s located in the business district which is very quiet at night and there are no restaurants or dining options nearby after 10pm. And there are no room service as well. Only option is the FamilyMart opposite of the road which is 24 hours.Otherwise, location is good, near to Imperial Palace and Tokyo Station. And the room has a great view of Mt Fuji!

If you are looking for some piece and quiet area in Tokyo area, try this place. Loaction is within walking distance to tokyo station. Plenty of good restaurant in basement of each buildings. Many good stores and caffee in Marunouchi area. Will definitely going back to rhis area for my next visit to Tokyo.

We were surprised it was much more than a 5 stars hotel. Elegant and prestige environment. With well train staffs who speak English very well. All furniture are new and clean. Classy and nice smell of fragrance. The sound proof is good, quiet walk way with beautiful posters.

An excellent 5 nights here. We stayed in 2 apartments -2 bedroom and 3 bedroom ( family of 9). Great facilities, decor and fittings and best of all spacious by Tokyo standards. What was impressive was the level of care and service. One of my kids fell ill and the Assistant Manager went of his way to get a doctor to visit and the team was thoughtful to suggest that they skip Housekeeping the next day so she could rest (they came by to change towels). They also proactively provided us with a thermometer and cold compress.

We stayed on My wife's birthday,we were relax and happy.Room is very spacious,late check out is very good. Thank you for present for my wife,candy,etc.We want to visit Ascott Marunouchi Tokyo again,in a few days.

The rooms are so clean, nice decoratian, brand new , suitable for children, the kitchen is so clean , the staff is so helpful , and huge for 4 guests, we will consider to return back in the next trip to tokyo

123/5000Wǒmen shì dìng jīběn fáng, rùzhù shí yǒu shēng yī děngzhùfáng xiàng jiālǐ yīyàng ānjìng yǔ shūfú, fángjiān nèi de shèbèi fēicháng qíquán yǔ háohuáchuáng hěn dà, shuì dé hěn shūfú, yóuqí yǒu yīgè dà yùgāng, wánle yītiān pào pào rè shuǐ zǎo fēicháng shūfúpángbiān jiù yǒu dìtiě, lí dōngjīng chēzhàn bùxíng yuē 7~10 fēnzhōng (qǐng zǒu mǎlù, bùyào zǒu dìxiàdào)We are a basic room, a first-class check-inThe home is as quiet and comfortable as home, and the equipment in the room is complete and luxuriousVery large bed, very comfortable to sleep, especially with a large bathtub, playing a day hot bubble bath very comfortableNext to the subway, walk from Tokyo Station about 7 to 10 minutes (please take the road, do not go underground)

Stayed at the maranouchi for work for several days. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable. I don’t think I have ever stayed in such a high tech hotel. The rooms are also exceptionally quiet. Everything has a switch. Breakfast is a smaller buffet but very delicious they do eggs to order. The hotel doesn’t have a bar but underneath the building is a whole underground street of restaurants and bars.

Ascott Marunouchi was opened last March 2017. They have state of the art decor and fully equipped rooms. We stayed at a 54 square meters - 1 bedroom deluxe and they have a washing machine available. Cleanliness - five stars, staff were very helpful (well almost all the people we have encountered in Tokyo were helpful) and polite. The hotel atmosphere is very cozy and the interior is very elegant. Location is accessible. The nearest station is Otemachi which is a few (3-5) minutes walk. It is also near The Imperial palace East Gardens and Ginza the high-end shopping district.Because Ascott is new, there were few restaurants around. The building beside Ascott have restaurants and a convenient store (Family Mart) in the basement. Value for money? No, it is quite expensive in my opinion. Worth it? Definitely!

This is a place for mature travelers.Very friendly, caring and helpful staffs.Checked in pretty late and found it doesn’t as room service.Please double check on the advice given by the staff regarding transportation to airport.

we spent four nights here, very satisfied! my room facing the Palace, is nice view! front desk staff is friendly and professional, very grateful to the staff for our efforts to communicate with the Japanese restaurant! will stay next time!

modern clean one bedroom with good location. Facilities are in good condition. Good house keeping work. There are plenty of restaurants, shops nearly the Tokyo station and Marunouchi area. I would stay in this area again.

This is a beautiful apartment. I stayed in the 1br Deluxe apartment. High end finishes and lovely decor. Fantastic location in the business district and super close to Tokyo station. It doesn't have a bar but has a lovely lobby lounge. Great for the business traveller.

Very good location ( near Tokyo station and ginza The rooms are beautiful the lobby as well All the design is beautiful The pool is amazing The hotel Worths room service or food 24/day ( because of jet lag)

Stayed here for 6 nights in the 1 bedroom apartment/hotel (55sqm). This is definitely one of the best service apartments that I have stayed at. The furnishings are very modern and the amenities very good. The location is in the heart of the financial district, so its quiet at night. Tokyo station is about a 5-10 minute walk away, but there is a train station nearby (Otemachi). There's one restaurant in the building (didn't try it) as there are plenty of options available nearby. Overall, I would highly recommend Ascott, if you like modern, new, spacious and decently located (for holiday and business trips alike). There is plenty of food within walking distance!

The services and facilities are exceeds our expectations.Location is very convenient, Subway station is underneath the building.Highly recommend. Breakfast is very fresh and various. We werereally glad we made this choice.

Rooms are generous in size, service is bad. I checked in around 11pm and there is no restaurant opened in the vicinity. I asked the reception who looked like no one ever asked about food past 11pm. They took very long to find a solution and a venue opened

I was thoroughly enjoyed my stay in Ascott Serviced apartments in Tokyo.It was short business trip and the hotel was an oasis after whole day of work . I had a room with wonderful view on the Imperial Palace, quiet and in very convenient location. Having breakfast in the hotel, kitchen facilities ans washing machine in the room: all this made my stay comfortable and enjoyable. I will try to book this hotel every time I am in Tokyo

The Best room i have in Tokyo, the hotel is new and the room is big, including a dinning area, kitchen, washing machine with clothes dryer. The JR station just in minutes. The hotel is located in a commercial area, so is quiet and relax.

somewhat disappointed due to it DOES NOT CONFORMED AS ADVERTIST/ PROMTOTED in booking.com. The place as cool and vibrant + high end hotel service apartment. Ascott need to review it's offer in all their partners as this will damaged their reputation.The place is far from mall/s and not so many places to eat within the area.

This is our second time stay in Ascott. We traveled in Tokyo last July and have very good impression of Ascott that’s why we chose Ascott again . Good location, comfortable room, professional and kind staff. Highly recommended!

The hotel has very good service where the rooms and the gym are perfect for business or pleasure traveler. I would online invest in a more diversed breakfast. The overall experience was perfect and I recommend

These are exceptionally high quality serviced apartments with super interior décor and appointments. Very comfortable, and we had an excellent large TV screen with many English channels including movies. The staff are very friendly and speak English. An easy walk to the Tokyo station, a food mart opposite and a restaurant area in the basement floor. A very comfortable and convenient place to stay.

This is more of a "serviced apartment" type establishment but with luxury hotel touches like excellent service, super clean and comfortable rooms. Very modern style which is a plus to me. You feel like you are staying somewhere special. Although it's in the business district it is very well located to the train and subway systems so travelling is a breeze. This is really a superb place to stay if you are on business or if you like a more independent hotel experience. I'll be back. Recommended!

Very nice hotel, we stayed there for about a week in September. Great views to Tokyo and gardens (at least from 29 floor). Very friendly and helpful staff, great location.Would recommend to stay if you visiting Tokyo

We stayed for 4 days at the start of our travels in Japan. Everything was perfect; the room (great view of the skyline over the Imperial Palace), linens, service, amenities (gym, pool, and morning yoga class) and restaurant for breakfast. The place feels almost brand new and the staff are very attentive and helpful.

Al you want for your stay in Tokyo: apartments have a full kitchen including washer/dryer, a gym, pool and stunning city views. Only a 15 minute walk from Tokyo station and two steps away from Otemachi metro station.

We stayed in a studio room for 3 nights, and we were so happy we chose this hotel/apartment. The room is modern and clean and luckily with a washer/dryer and a kitchenette. The hotel provided a packet of detergent (refill next day when we used one). The view from the windows - Tokyo skyline and the Imperial Park - was incredible. The hotel is in the Otemachi business area close to Tokyo Station with a lot of places to eat, have a drink, and shop within a walking distance, including Ginza and Marunouchi. We walked and biked around the Imperial Park. The service was excellent. We hope to stay here again when we return to Tokyo.

Stayed here during 2weeks business trip. Very nice location and quality. Compared to nearby hotels, rate for a flat here is more or less the same. But what a difference a flat brings when away for 2 weeks.Staff very friendly and making you feel "at home"Nice selection for breakfast. The hours could however be a little longer for breakfast (L.O 09:30 all days). Especially to allow for a "lazy sunday" with a little later breakfast. But this is probably a matter of habits. :-)Nice gym open 24/7.

This property is quite new with service apt style. Room is very big with good location, so closed to Imperial Palace and connected Ometachi Station. The lobby is on 22nd floor with good view of Tokyo Skyline. The service from the staffs are excellent. In the room, the kitchen utensils and equipments are complete so it is possible to cook and do laundry. Although the swimming pool is very small, the gym room is quite good and spacious. Although the Airport limousine bus is not stop here, the staff would be happy to help book the ticket and bring luggages to the nearest stop. All in all, I would stay here again whenever I visit Tokyo and would recommend other to stay here too

We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite for 3 days, then another 1 night returning through Tokyo.We got the same suite both stays--> 2913.This suite is HUGE by Asian standards. One of the nicest suites I have ever stayed in.Bedrooms were large, with comfortable beds. Plenty of charging ports for electronics.Fast Wifi. Robes and pyjamas provided.Amazing water pressure in the bathroom showers.Nespresso machine is a nice touch.Very convenient location for tourists. Directly connected to Otemachi Metro station (exit C6a towards the Otemachi Park Building/Otemachi Hotoria). If you have luggage--take a cab to and from Tokyo Station--the Marunouchi line is a bit a walk with bags. (Tourist should definitely download the iPhone Tokyo Subway App!)We took taxis twice to the hotel. Both times we were dropped in the taxi area to the side of the building. This was a bit worrisome when we first arrived as we didn't quite know where we were going, but once we found the front sign, the lobby was easily accessed by elevator. I would highly recommend this hotel for Families wishing to stay in a suite together. Friendly and helpful staff!Only thing I didn't find stellar was breakfast. We had breakfast in their restaurant the first morning we were there. It was a bit underwhelming for the cost. Much better options in the city. Would definitely stay here again!

Ascott is a well known serviced apartment. I like Ascott Marunouchi Tokyo very much. Modern design, comfortable bed, nice view, fully equipped kitchen and washing machine, friendly and helpful staff, convenient location - subway is located at the basement of the apartment. It is not an issue they only have one restaurant as you could find more downstairs. Only one thing they need to improve is get someone to attend the entrance area - it is good for customers.

Loved staying here, it felt like home after the week stay. The value for the money was great compared to other hotels. Neighborhood was not lively, but it was convenient. The room was very spacious and felt luxurious. Much better than a standard corp apartment and everything felt brand new. Will be back!

Exceptional in every way. Brand new. Exceptionally luxurious. Beautifully designed from entry to rooms. Located in a beautiful area with a subway entrance just a few meters away. Nespresso machine in every room. Free coffee in the lobby. Spectacular art work. Fantastic view over the palace gardens. Beautifully designed and first class service.

Short business trip to Tokyo. The hotel is very convenient for offices and well served by the metro. The staff are helpful, the hotel is new and high quality with great rooms. The rationale rooms have a separate lounge and the shower was superb. Nothing to fault it on at all.

Our stay in Ascott Marunouchi was great, warm welcome by the staff, the suite was incredible, great view, larger than excepted, perfect to stay with the whole family in only one room. The facilities are also very nice, diner and breakfast were much appreciated. Price is definitely reasonable for the confort you get.I only wish I asked for a room with the view on the imperial garden.Would highly recommend!

One of the best place i have ever stayed in, in the journey around the world spanning 23 countries for the last 17years, everything from location to upkeep of the property is top notch and elegant,location is central and close to Otemachi station, also close to Tokyo station, Ginza,Akhibara electric town, will love to visit this place again and again,

Just when I thought it was not possible, I found Ascott Marunouchi Tokyo. This is a reasonably priced apartment hotel - mine was a double bed with kitchen and modest sitting area partitioned from the bedroom. The design is chic modern and functional. The kitchen has an espresso machine, range, oven and dish washer. A washer- dryer combo hides away in a closet. Everything seemed new and luxurious. The location- it is a walkable 3 blocks from Tokyo station - hub to JR Shinkansen and subway lines. The property is new and most taxi drivers don't know of it -so do keep a website map printout handy. The hotel lobby is on the 22nd floor. Staff are super helpful and smiling. The comfort and convenience of the hotel is off-set by a few cons- no lobby bar to relax in (free coffee machine though) There is a breakfast/lunch place all days and dinners on weekdays. If the breakfast is part of your deal, take it as it is a bit pricey add on ($30). The immediate area around the property is devoid of eateries on weekends. But really, the proximity to Tokyo station means you will have plenty of choices within minutes. The east garden gate of the Imperial palace is within 5 minutes walk and Ginza is a 15 minute cab ride away.All in all, spacious, reasonably priced service accommodation at a great location.

I am absolutely satisfied with my 5-day stay in Ascott Marunouchi Tokyo. I am especially happy with the strong power of the shower head, the excellent quality of the bed (It's Sealy) and the overall cleanliness of the premise. I hope they can keep their standard and next time when I visit Tokyo, it will be my choice. The accessibility is also impeccable, as the hotel is located above Otemachi Station, one stop from Tokyo and two from Ginza. And nearby there is a business building where I can find a convenient store, a drugstore and lots of restaurants.

Enjoyed our stay. Excellent location. Easy access to train station, restaurants, cafes. Clean room. We like the strong water pressure in the bathroom. Breakfast is included with the room rate and it is decent. The breakfast room has a view of the garden, however, the garden needs to be maintained. I suggest a Japanese zen garden would make a beautiful calming ambiance.

The hotel has only been open a few months. Reception is on the 22nd floor, and is a large, bright space with highly efficient front desk staff. There is a large lobby lounge with plenty of seating. I stayed in a single bedroom suite, which had its own cooking facilities, fridge and washing machine. Very large by Tokyo standards, with a substantial lounge/kitchen area, a good size king bedded room, two toilets, and a generous bathroom. Ample hanging space. Only downer was the bed, as the mattress was far too firm. Wifi worked well. Definitely a good option in the Marunouchi area.

A new and comfortable hotel with stylish design. Staff is helpful.It is 10 minutes walk from Tokyo Station if you find the right way.The room is spacious and the mattress is of high quality so we can have a good sleep!

We had a very pleasant stay at Ascott Marunouchi Tokyo. The property is located directly above a Metro station and within walkable distance to the Tokyo station and shopping area at Marunouchi and a supermarket. Had the best sleep (for a hotel/ service apartment) as the property is located in a quieter area of Tokyo and the beds were excellent.

Now this is going to sound a bit weird and pedantic. I know that they never said that each room will have it's own washing machine, but after staying in other hotels in Tokyo, i believe that there will be at least a laundry room somewhere in the hotel. So after checking in, i asked for the laundry room because i noticed that there isnt a washing machine in our room. The woman actually looked around in the closet but eventually said that there is none in the room and there is no coin laundry in the building. So i asked we we could be moved to another room with one. She said if you opted for an extra bed (for my son), then you ll get no washing machine (which i thought was a bit weird since the washing machine is in the closet and its not going to interfere with the space used for the extra bed) but i said okay, can we get a room with the extra bed AND the washing machine? She said yes. SO we packed our things and went downstairs to the lobby to get a new room. The man said, this room will have a washing machine but the extra bed is not yet prepared, i said fine we will wait. He gave us a new pair of keys and we went up. The room has a washing machine. So we just have to wait for the extra bed. After about 10 minutes the man called our room and said we cant have an extra bed and a washing machine. I asked if we could just pay for an upgrade so we can have both. He said yes we can, for 2,400Y a night we can have an executive room. Now, i already had my suspicion because 2,400Y for an upgrade per night in Ascott Marunouchi would be considered nothing short of a miracle. So we went downstairs to the lobby - again - to pay for the upgrade and get our new room keys. The bill was for 24,000Y per night. I smiled, sighed and paid because my suspicions were correct. Anyway, it was smooth sailing after that. We got a new room. It was huge by Japanese standard. It features 2 full closet, 1 full size shoe closet, a fully equipped kitchen, a washing machine and other standard features of a five star hotels. The cleanliness as always perfect in Japan. You can go straight to a food court and the Metro lines without ever going out of the hotel itself. Very useful if you're staying in the hot month of July. Pretty much perfect.

We discovered Ascott online and initially chose it for the location and the fact that it was newly opened. The airport driver got a bit lost finding the hotel at first (since it is only a few months old), but once we got there everything else was amazing. The service was excellent - the staff went over and beyond what was expected. We decided to upgrade to a 1 bedroom suite and the size was perfect for 2 adults and 2 kids (5 and 7 years old).Our son celebrated his birthday this trip and the staff helped us plan a trip to Thomas Land and even surprised him with a birthday treat!I had to do some work on the last day and the business center was perfect. Bonus too were the daily yoga classes available. While Ascott is on top of a subway exit, the walk is quite far. Best to take a taxi to Tokyo Station and go from there. We would definitely recommend staying here. A serviced apartment with 5 star hotel standards!

I picked this place due to location and what appeared to be a very high quality accommodation, we were very impressed. From the moment we arrived until our departure 2 days later, we experienced top service and an exquisite property top to bottom. Our original booking didn't include breakfast, but when we checked in they gave us complimentary breakfasts for both mornings of our stay. Later that same night the front desk staff happily helped us locate a restaurant open late and had the taxi waiting downstairs and gave the driver full instructions on how to get us there. If you are looking for a place to call home for an extended period, this place will impress.

Finally, what Tokyo has been missing for so many years, a top notch 5 star furnished service apartment. An alternative to the many other 5 star hotel offering in the area, it does offer a lot more space especially for the premier one bedroom executive in prime Tokyo real estate.The location is slightly off the sights and main shopping thoroughfare even though Marounochi Street shopping is a 10 min stroll away and Tokyo Station is a 15min walk.Service level is limited as one would expect from a service apartment as compared to a full fledged hotel.However, the additional space, fully equipped kitchenette with oven, stove, washing and dryer, dishwasher makes up for it!

We knew the hotel just opened, but it carries the Ascott brand so we expected a certain level of service. They were polite, but don't expect them to go out of their way to help. They will answer your question - but not offer options. I was inquiring about airport transfers, and was told to book Uber!

Outstanding memorable stay!!!!!!! Superb location, quiet, stately, wonderful people, out of their way to help and accommodate. Superb architecturally, elegant, hard think of a better place for that money in Tokyo, or anywhere else for that matter!

The just recently opened (March 2017) Ascott Maunouchi is a great choice for families staying in Tokyo. It has all the facilities you would expect from a hotel (breakfast, restaurant, pool, gym), but because it has service apartments, you get more space, and the convenience of washing machine, dryer, fully equipped kitchen etc. We had a 38m2 studio apartment for 4 nights, which was perfect for a family of 3 travelling with a toddler (they also provided a baby cot free of charge). All in all, it looks 5* and it feels 5*!Location is good – quiet, and overlooking the Royal Palace. Even it if rains, you can get anywhere by either walking underground to Tokyo station (takes you 10-15 minutes) or getting onto a train from the station below the hotel.

Stayed at this newly opened service apartment style hotel in May.The location is conveniently located near Otemachi where four lines interchange. The hotel itself is modern, spacious and well equipped. It's pretty rare to see such spacious bathrooms in the center of Tokyo. The staff is professional and super attentive. Didn't get to try the all see through pool tho. I definitely recommend this place if you are traveling for business. It is reasonably priced and nicely furnished.

Sitting in a swanky two bed apartment by the Ascott group in their new property in Tokyo in the Marunouchi area. Though it is in a business area all the major traveller attraction..shopping,dining etc are a few minutes away by the Metro or a taxi. Stayed in a two bedroom apartment on 25th floor. The reception is on the 22nd floor and offers fully serviced apartments from studio to a penthouse. The staff is super attentive and polite and the apartment is a luxurious delight in space starved Tokyo. Is it exorbitant? Not considering most major global cities would charge US $ 300 and upwards for a double room. The apartment is nicely furnished, with modern amenities and facilities as expected in a property of this type. Definitely worth a second visit if I come to Tokyo again.

Once we found out that Ascott Marunouchi opened its doors this spring in Tokyo, we cancelled our reservation at a 5* hotel and booked a 1 Bdrm Luxury apartment at Ascott instead. It was the best thing we could have done! It made our trip! The place is immaculate, extra clean, very modern, with outstanding staff and service (special thanks to Mari and Maki), great and spacious rooms with hard wood floors and very well designed. Extremely comfortable beds and pillows with both bath and shower. The Nespresso coffee machine a big plus! The location is fabulous in the midst of the financial district with wide and clean sidewalks and very centrally located (FYI New Yorkers, comparable to mid-town Manhattan), 1/2 a block from the Otemachi train station that connects to all key lines. In just minutes you could access all the sightseeings and key areas. It is 4 blocks away from the Tokyo station which is key to travelling to Kyoto and other out of town places with the Shingansen bullet train. All you may need is at your door step from convenience stores to restaurants, Starbucks coffee, metro, ATM's, banks, currency exchanges etc. Can't say enough about it! Book it and you won't regret it! We didn't book the breakfast because we did not want to be constrained by the hours of service; nevertheless, we found the price a bit out of line. Finally, the cozy swimming pool is a great retreat after a long day out!

We stayed for only a night at the beginning of our trip to Japan but we spent most of the trip wishing we stayed at this property longer. The rooms are immaculate and well appointed. The service was impeccable. And the amount of space we got was phenomenal for Japanese accommodations. The hotel is located within 8-10 minutes walk of tokyo station, 15 minutes to Ginza shopping district, and is situated over a subway line and adjacent to the beautiful Imperial Palace Gardens. While many will recommend to stay in the middle of busier neighborhoods, the accommodations and easy access to transportation are well worth the location.

Excellently maintained property and centrally located with great amenities and service. All the appliances have been well thought of and provided at the appropriate places. Great property for a family looking for a kitchen.

The room is very new and very well furnished. It is very new and hygienic. My family and I are very pleased with it. I think it is one of the best place to stay in Tokyo. The next time we visit Tokyo, we will definitely come back here again.

Lovely stay for my family and anyone looking to stay in a new hotel or quieter part of tokyo's business district. We booked a studio room which comes with small kitchenette and complete full bathroom. The studio was comfortable, modern and clean for 2 pax but unfortunately ours have no view.Location is a little off central to Tokyo station and probably takes 6-8mins by taxi. Otemachi metro line is below the hotel but it is 5-10mins walk to reach the station.Food choices are rather limited and they do not provide room service. This can be a bumper when you are hungry at night and no restaurants nearby.My child was disappointed that the swimming pool is not open to kids below 16 years old.Overall, it was a comfortable stay for us but compare to nearby 5* hotels, there is still much to improve in service offerings at Ascott.

We were so lucky to come across the Ascott as many hotels were booked for our dates and there wasn't anything 'luxe' left on Airbnb. Newly opened, the Ascott has excellent finishings and interiors, on par with any 5 star hotel. The opening rates are great value and we were very happy with our deluxe 1 BR with studio room attached. Had a view of the imperial palace. Overall the location is central, about a 7 min cab ride to Ginza and the train station is just below the hotel. Would highly recommend a stay here.

Everything is excellent Luxury stayRoom is new, modern , with big windows enjoy the scenery view Day and night of the City & Palace Good for visitors keep away from crowded Nearby area with good and quality life style

We stayed at the Ascott Maranouchi on the way back from Hiroshima. The hotel is brand new and was open only for two weeks, well, this was a great surprise with a very dedicated staff and a very beautiful lobby where you check in. The hotel is well situated in the heart of Maranouchi with a lot of restaurants nearby and some shopping. The breakfast was good but I would add a little bit, for example, french toast or pancakes, other than, that there was more than enough.The rooms were very comfy and well decorated with all the amenities. A very good hotel.

review_body: Its a nice new hotel with rooms being excellent and all top class equipment in kitchen. We stayed here for 4 nights. The house keeping was excellent. The staff in front office is not much friendly and they even misguided us about cherry blossom lighting in the night which had ended few days back and that wasted our full evening and not to mention the trouble of entire family going and coming back disappointed. Also even the front office is not well versed with english and is difficult to communicate.The location is good but beware that it isnt that close to Otemachi station as there are numerous exits but its a long walk within the sub way to reach to the platform.The lobby is not on the ground floor and there is not a single staff or sign to guide gusts to the lobby which is in upper floors.Overall a good stay and will consider staying again but shall have to consider other options as well.

Overall the hotel is spacious, clean, nicely and stylish design, with convenient location just next to MetroThere is still a need to improve on some services such as breakfast, front desk, but overall it's goodThere seems a slightly weak expression on being a hotel from Japan, if I need to compare their service delivery with nearby Peninsula, Palace or Mandarin, or may be it will take some time to achieve this standard.

Staff was so welcomeThe Room was Good and neat. Nice design!! There's washing machine, dish washer, microwave etc.Kamar bagus rapi dan kualitas hotel bintang 5Too bad Limited seat at breakfast and they closed around 9.30.The breakfast Staff was so helpful and welcomeYou have to make a long que. cause it's limited seatThe food wasnt have so much variety. Makanan sedikit tidak banyak variasiLocation not too good. It's business district.Lokasi tidak dekat dg shopping mall dan tempat makan. Dekat dg perkantoran

We stayed here a few days after it had just opened. Beautifully appointed rooms which were quite well kitted out, kitchen, two led TVs, great shower with awesome water pressure, the list goes on. Only criticism would be the breakfast buffet was a bit repetitive after a few days! The hotel is located about 10 min walk from Tokyo station and has an Otemachi subway station entry point right out from (however Otemachi station is quite big and has numerous exits so you still may need to walk about 5-10mins to your platform potentially). It is quite close to the Imperial Palace East Garden gate.
